0.title: I essayed the role of tree in school plays; never got the main role: Ananya
0.article_body: Ananya Panday said she was in the background in her school plays and essayed the role of a tree, standing with her arms raised. "I'd audition but never land the main role," she added. When asked about this transiting from being in...background to being the lead actress, Ananya said, "I'm just happy that I get to be an actor."

1.title: 75% of Punjab MLAs are crorepatis, AAP's Kulwant Singh richest with ₹238-cr assets
1.article_body: The new Punjab Assembly has nearly 75% MLAs who are crorepatis, according to a report by the Association for Democratic Reforms and the Punjab Election Watch. AAP has 63 MLAs who are crorepatis including the richest Kulwant Singh who declared ₹238-crore assets. Congress has 17 crorepati MLAs, SAD has three, BJP has two, BSP has one and one is Independent.

2.title: Over 28 lakh people fled Ukraine since Russia attack: UN
2.article_body: Over 28 lakh people have fled Ukraine since Russia attacked the country, said the United Nations on Monday, making it Europe's biggest refugee crisis since World War II. European Union officials have estimated that the number of refugees could reach 50 lakh, while some have predicted the figure to be higher. Lakhs of people have reportedly been displaced within Ukraine.

3.title: Pant will become India's highest-scoring wicketkeeper in Tests: Irfan Pathan
3.article_body: Praising wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant over his performance in the Sri Lanka Tests, Irfan Pathan said the 24-year-old will end his career as India's highest run-scoring wicketkeeper-batter in Test cricket. "At such a young age, so much improvement has been seen in his cricket," added Irfan. Pant scored 96, 39 and 50 runs in the two Tests against Sri Lanka.

4.title: Real normalcy in J&K after abrogation of Article 370: Nirmala Sitharaman
4.article_body: There has been a "fake normalcy" in Jammu and Kashmir since Independence under the garb of Article 370 and after its abrogation, now there is real normalcy there, Union Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. "How can we say there was normalcy in Kashmir earlier when the Constitution of India was not applicable there?" Sitharaman added.

5.title: SC questions pension for Kerala ministers' staff after 2yrs service
5.article_body: Supreme Court, while taking note of an Indian Express report, has criticised Kerala government's policy of giving "life-long" pensions to state ministers' staff after only two years of service. The court was hearing a plea by Kerala transport corporation against state-owned companies' high fuel prices. "If you've...money for [pensions], why are you here for this?" it said for the plea.

6.title: Wearing hijab not an essential religious practice, says Karnataka HC as it upholds hijab ban
6.article_body: Karnataka High Court on Tuesday dismissed writ petitions filed by Muslim girl students seeking permission to wear hijab in colleges. The court held prescription of uniform as a reasonable restriction, saying that wearing of hijab is not an essential religious practice of the Islamic faith. Notably, Section 144 of CrPC is imposed in many parts of Karnataka till March 21.

7.title: Have uniformity, don't involve politics in remission cases: SC to UP govt
7.article_body: Supreme Court told the Uttar Pradesh government to not involve politics in remission cases and maintain uniformity. "We are coming across cases specifically from UP where no yardsticks are followed...Somebody goes out after nine years while others are incarcerated for more than 20 years," it added. "Follow one standard...And those standards must be followed in all cases," SC stated.

8.title: He's always ready to help: Abhimanyu on working with Akshay Kumar
8.article_body: Actor Abhimanyu Singh, speaking about working with Akshay Kumar in the upcoming film 'Bachchhan Paandey', said, "It's always fun to work with him." "He makes you feel very comfortable...[He's] always ready to help you on the set and off the set," he added. "Also, his one-liners are so funny most of the time that you can never forget," Abhimanyu said.

9.title: Poll results never surprised me, Cong going downhill since 2014: Sibal
9.article_body: Days after the election results were announced in five states, Congress leader Kapil Sibal said that the results "never surprised" him. "We have been going downhill since 2014. We have lost state after state...In the meantime, there has been an exodus of some key people...those who had the confidence of the leadership...moving away from the Congress," Kapil added.

10.title: Never visualised our morality going so low: SC on misuse of COVID death aid
10.article_body: The Supreme Court hinted at directing a CAG probe over the misuse of its order and people getting COVID death compensation of ₹50,000 on the basis of fake documents issued by doctors. "We never visualised that our morality can go so low that these kinds of fake claims would be made...never thought this scheme could be misused," the court said.

11.title: US-based inFeedo, founded by 2 Indians, raises $12 million
11.article_body: US-based employee experience platform ﻿inFeedo﻿ has raised $12 million in funding from Jungle Ventures and Tiger Global. Other investors who participated in the funding included Bling Capital, Zeta Founder Bhavin Turakhia, Gainsight Co-founder Sreedhar Peddineni, Freshworks CHRO Suman Gopalan and Ankur Warikoo. The startup was founded by two Indians Tanmaya Jain and Varun Puri.

12.title: Domestic air passenger traffic nears pre-COVID-19 level: Scindia in Parliament
12.article_body: After suffering huge losses, the civil aviation industry is close to reaching pre-COVID-19 pandemic level as traffic of 3,80,000 passengers per day was recorded in December 2021, Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia told the Rajya Sabha. Responding to a question by Shiv Sena MP Anil Desai, Scindia said that the domestic traffic was close to about 4,00,000 passengers before the pandemic.

13.title: Wouldn't believe I'd get paired with Deepika, I come from nowhere: Siddhant
13.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi, who was last seen with actress Deepika Padukone in 'Gehraiyaan', said that if someone had told him he would be paired with the actress in a film, he wouldn't have believed it. "I come from nowhere. Chuck pebble in dark in movie theatre and person it hits would be me, less than ten years ago," Siddhant added.

14.title: Taunts over loss in Odisha rural polls makes woman attempt suicide, husband dies
14.article_body: A man allegedly hanged himself to death in Odisha's Basudevpur after his wife consumed insecticide following a fight between the couple following alleged taunts over her loss in the panchayat elections. According to the police, the man had an argument with supporters of the winning candidate. Later, a fight broke out between the couple, after which she consumed insecticide.

15.title: War will likely be over by early May, Russia will run out of resources: Ukraine
15.article_body: Oleksiy Arestovich, an adviser to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's chief of staff, has said that the war in Ukraine is likely to be over by early May when Russia runs out of resources. Talks between Ukraine and Russia have so far produced very few results other than several humanitarian corridors. The war in Ukraine began on February 24.

16.title: Twin towers in Noida to be demolished in 9 seconds using over 2,500 kg explosives
16.article_body: Supertech's 40-storey twin towers in Noida's Sector 93A will be demolished within nine seconds, according to Edifice Engineering, the firm planning the demolition. Holes will be drilled into the towers' columns to place the explosives. Around 2,500-4,000 kilograms of explosives could be required, an official said. "Loading the structure with the explosives can take 12-15 days," the official added.

17.title: Strategy formulated to promote medical tourism in India: G Kishan Reddy
17.article_body: Union Minister for Tourism G Kishan Reddy said government has formed a strategy for promoting India as a medical and wellness tourism destination. A National Medical and Wellness Tourism Board has been formed for the implementation of the roadmap, the minister said while replying to a question in Lok Sabha. E-Medical visas have been introduced for 156 countries, he added.

18.title: 30-yr-old Guj man objects to harassment of mentally unstable man, killed
18.article_body: A 30-year-old man, Amit Rathod, from Gujarat's Ahmedabad was killed by four men after he objected to harassment of a mentally unstable man. The four accused have been arrested by the police. They have been identified as Naresh Gathiyo, Ramesh Makkhi, Gautam Chavda and Jay Chino. FIR said that Rathod died after being stabbed multiple times by the accused.

19.title: Delhi to get 100 more e-vehicle charging stations by June 27
19.article_body: Hundred new e-vehicle charging stations with 500 charging points will be set up across "prime locations" in Delhi by June 27, Power Minister Satyendar Jain said. Of the 100 stations, 71 will be built in parking lots and premises of metro stations, he added. Jain further said that the charge for using the station facility would be "₹2 per unit".

20.title: Amazon accuses Future Retail, Reliance Industries of 'fraud' in newspaper ads
20.article_body: Amazon on Tuesday took out ads in newspapers, accusing Future Retail and Reliance Industries of "fraud" after Reliance took over several Future stores. Amazon and Future are currently engaged in a legal battle over the ₹24,713-crore Future-Reliance deal. In the ads, Amazon said, "These actions have been done in a clandestine manner by playing a fraud on...constitutional courts in India."

21.title: UAPA accused Ishrat Jahan gets bail in Delhi riots conspiracy case
21.article_body: A Delhi court on Monday granted bail to former Congress councillor Ishrat Jahan in connection with 2020 Northeast Delhi riots conspiracy case. She was accused under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA). She was neither physically present in Northeast Delhi for riots nor was she part of any group, the court stated. Jahan was earlier granted bail in another case.

22.title: Video of Aaradhya's speech in Hindi goes viral, dad Abhishek Bachchan reacts
22.article_body: A video of Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's daughter Aaradhya Bachchan reciting a Hindi poem has recently surfaced on the internet. The video is seemingly taken from an online Hindi elocution competition held at Aaradhya's school, which showed her praising the Hindi language. Taking to Twitter, Abhishek reacted to the compliments that Aaradhya was receiving with a folded-hand emoji.

23.title: Russia-Ukraine war could lead to global food crisis: IMF
23.article_body: The International Monetary Fund has warned that the Russia-Ukraine war can send the world's food supply into chaos as Ukrainian farmers are unable to plant crops such as wheat. It warned of global food insecurity if the war continued. Meanwhile, UN chief Antonio Guterres called for averting a "hurricane of hunger and a meltdown of the global food system".

24.title: Shreyas Iyer could be the next big thing in Indian cricket: Gavaskar
24.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar, on being asked if Shreyas Iyer could be the next big thing in Indian cricket, said, "Yes, certainly, he's looking like that." Gavaskar added, "It's very attractive batting that he has, the shots he has...He's a good-looking young man." Shreyas remained unbeaten in T20Is and scored 27, 92 and 67 in two Tests against Sri Lanka.

25.title: Earthquake of magnitude 4.1 hits Arunachal Pradesh
25.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 4.1 hit the Pangin town in Arunachal Pradesh's Siang district on Tuesday, the National Center for Seismology (NCS) informed. "Earthquake of Magnitude: 4.1, occurred on 15-03-2022, 08:21:03 IST, Lat: 30.08 & Long: 95.18, Depth: 10 Km, Location: 215km N of Pangin, Arunachal Pradesh," NCS tweeted. Its epicentre was located 215 km north of Pangin.

26.title: Russia could use chemical weapons against Ukraine in ‘false-flag’ operation: UK
26.article_body: The UK's defence ministry has warned that Russia may attack Ukraine using chemical and biological weapons in a 'false-flag' operation, that is, by accusing Kyiv of using such weapons first. "Such an operation could take form of a faked attack, a staged 'discovery' of agents or munitions or fabricated evidence of alleged Ukrainian planning to use such weapons," it said.

27.title: Delhi police arrest 3 for supplying illegal firearms, seize 9 guns
27.article_body: Delhi police said on Monday that they've arrested three men, aged between 20 and 29, for allegedly supplying illegal firearms in the national capital and Punjab. Nine semi-automatic pistols and 12 cartridges were also recovered from the accused's possession, police added. Two accused were caught at a bus stand in Mayur Vihar, while the third accused was arrested from Ludhiana.

28.title: Hurled stone at liquor vend for dignity of women, kids: Uma Bharti to MP CM
28.article_body: In a letter to Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan, former Union Minister Uma Bharti claimed she hurled a stone at a liquor shop in Bhopal for the dignity of the state's women and children. "Some women...told me that some men, after getting drunk, turned towards the women and children residing in these colonies and urinated," Bharti said.

29.title: Vivek Agnihotri trampled B'wood, created his own 'Vivekwood': RGV
29.article_body: Following the release of The Kashmir Files, Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter to praise the film's director Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri. He wrote that apart from the "explosive material he so daringly exposed, Vivek trampled Bollywood by creating his own 'Vivekwood'". He added this will "inspire a new breed of revolutionary filmmakers...and that's the ultimate victory more than Kashmir Files'...success".

30.title: Police open fire at diesel thieves in Bengaluru, 2 arrested
30.article_body: Bengaluru Police opened fire at a gang of four diesel thieves near KEB Circle in Jigani industrial area on Sunday. According to police, the gang had been stealing petrol from parked vehicles for days and when the police team caught them, the accused tried to attack the officers. Police added, main accused, Srinivasa Raju, was shot at and arrested.

31.title: Gandhis will take Congress to a situation where it won't be visible: Assam CM
31.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said that the Gandhis will take Congress to a situation where it won't be visible even in panchayat elections in the days to come. "Successive defeats in elections have proved that the Gandhis cannot lead Congress to victory," Sarma added. The Congress party lost in all the five states where Assembly polls were held recently.

32.title: Gurugram businesswoman cheated of ₹6 lakh by fake manufacturing firm
32.article_body: The Gurugram Police booked several unidentified suspects of a fake manufacturing firm for allegedly cheating a 36-years-old businesswoman of ₹6 lakh. The victim, Gunjan Sharma, owns an electronic devices showroom and she allegedly ordered 100 LED TVs and 20 ACs worth ₹12 lakh from the fake firm last year. After making 50% advance payment, Sharma did not receive the products.

33.title: Filmmaker Ahmed Khan arrives in his 'Batmobile' to watch 'The Batman', pics go viral
33.article_body: Pictures have gone viral on social media showing choreographer-director Ahmed Khan arriving at a theatre in Mumbai in his 'Batmobile' to watch 'The Batman'. Ahmed's car is based on the vehicle driven by Hollywood star Michael Keaton in 1989's 'Batman' and 1992's 'Batman Returns'. He had gifted the limited-edition Batmobile to his wife Shaira Khan on her birthday last year.

34.title: WWE legend Razor Ramon dies at 63 after suffering 3 heart attacks following hip surgery
34.article_body: WWE Hall of Famer Scott Hall, popularly known as Razor Ramon, died aged 63 after suffering three heart attacks following a hip surgery. He had started his career in 1984 and had joined World Championship Wrestling in 1991 as The Diamond Studd. He signed with WWE in 1992 as Cuban-American character Razor Ramon. He was a four-time WWE Intercontinental Champion.

35.title: Video shows the moment kabaddi player Sandeep Nangal was shot dead in Punjab
35.article_body: A video showing the moment international kabaddi player Sandeep Nangal was shot dead in Punjab has surfaced online. A personal rivalry or professional jealousy could be the reason behind the incident, police said. Sandeep was among top five kabaddi players of the world and head of Major Kabaddi League Federation. Sandeep is survived by his parents, wife and two sons.

36.title: 4 dead, 15 hurt as fire causes cylinder blast in building in J&K
36.article_body: Four people, including a child, have died and 15 injured after a fire broke out at a scrap shop in a building in Jammu and Kashmir's Jammu on Monday. The fire engulfed the entire building and some LPG cylinders exploded, SSP Chandan Kohli said. The Union Territory's L-G Manoj Sinha's Office announced a ₹5 lakh ex-gratia for the deceased's families.

37.title: A year after Suez Canal blocking, another giant Evergreen ship runs aground in US
37.article_body: A year after a giant container ship got stuck in the Suez Canal for nearly a week and disrupted global trade, another Evergreen Marine Corp vessel has run aground. The 334-metre vessel was en route to Virginia when it got stuck in US' Chesapeake Bay. It "isn't preventing other ships from transiting to the Port of Baltimore", an official said.

38.title: Last relationship ended 7 years ago, I would love to be in love: Rahul Bose
38.article_body: Actor Rahul Bose said that he has had five very long relationships in his life and that the last one finished seven years ago. "I've had a life full of romantic love. Would I like another relationship, or five, or ten? Of course. I would love to be in love, it would be fantastic," Rahul added.

39.title: Sunny Deol shares BTS video from sets of 1999 film 'Dillagi' featuring Bobby
39.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol took to Instagram to share a behind-the-scenes (BTS) video from the sets of his 1999 film 'Dillagi'. The video includes various BTS shots from 'Dillagi', featuring Bobby Deol and Urmila Matondkar. "Received this today. Beautiful memories Bob," Sunny wrote. Reacting to his post, a fan wrote, "Bobby's iconic hairstyle", while another fan wrote, "We want a sequel."

40.title: We have a good team, but batters didn't capitalise on conditions: Karunaratne
40.article_body: After losing both the Tests against India, Sri Lanka captain Dimuth Karunaratne said they had a good team but their batters didn't capitalise on conditions during the series. "The bowling was good, but we kept bowling loose deliveries every now and then," he added. Karunaratne scored 107 runs during their second innings in the pink-ball Test.

41.title: ICJ to pass verdict on Ukraine's case against Russia over invasion on Wednesday
41.article_body: The International Court of Justice would deliver its verdict on Ukraine's case against Russia over the invasion on Wednesday. Ukraine has accused Russia of attempting to justify its attack under an international convention by falsely claiming that the former committed genocide in some regions. Notably, Russia did not show up at the hearing held on March 7.

42.title: Self-proclaimed godman attempts to sacrifice 9-yr-old nephew, held in Thane
42.article_body: Police have arrested 40-year-old self-proclaimed godman. Kuldip Nikam, in Thane, for attempting to offer his 9-year-old nephew as "sacrifice". Nikam claimed that boy was possessed by evil spirit and that he would turn out to be a murderer and sexual assaulter in future. Police said that Nikam would regularly hint that the boy was dangerous and should be kept away.

43.title: Ukraine Prez shares letter he wrote to family of journalist shot dead by Russian forces
43.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has shared the letter that he wrote to the family of US journalist Brent Renaud, who was killed by Russian forces in Irpin. "With all his courage and determination, he travelled to the most dangerous war zones to film the unprecedented ruthlessness and evil, also inflicted on our nation by the aggressor state," Zelenskyy wrote.

44.title: India reports 2,568 new COVID-19 cases, 97 deaths in 24 hours
44.article_body: India has reported 2,568 new COVID-19 cases and 97 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 97 deaths, 26 deaths occurred during the day in the country, while 71 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,15,974, and the active cases declined to 33,917.

45.title: Outgoing BJP clears Pune civic body's draft budget of ₹9,716 cr
45.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) outgoing ruling party BJP on Monday cleared the draft civic budget of ₹9,716 crore for 2022-23. "We have included a lot of public interest schemes and projects in it," chairperson of the standing committee Hemant Rasane said. PMC school students will be given free tablets for online education at a cost of ₹10 crore.

46.title: Businessman's wife molested in Hyd's KBR Park, police launch manhunt
46.article_body: A Hyderabad-based businessman alleged that his wife was molested by an unknown assailant in KBR Park on Saturday morning. "All CCTV cameras are defunct at KBR Park," the businessman wrote on Twitter while reporting the incident. However, Banjara Hills ACP M Sudarshan said the victim has not lodged a written complaint, adding the police are trying to identify the accused.

47.title: We'll ensure Ukraine returnees complete their courses: Kerala CM
47.article_body: Kerala government will take all possible steps, after informing the Centre and NMC, for enabling Indian students coming from Ukraine to complete their courses in medicine and other subjects, CM Pinarayi Vijayan said. So far, 3,379 Malayali students have been repatriated to Kerala with the help of the Centre and the NORKA Development Offices in Delhi and Mumbai, CM added.

48.title: Rare Brambling spotted in Delhi-NCR for the first time
48.article_body: For the first time in Delhi and National Capital Region, birdwatchers spotted a rare non-breeding male Brambling in Gurugram's Bhondsi area on Sunday. The bird is usually found in northern Europe or in the western and higher Himalayas and Kashmir Valley in India. "There is no historical record of it being sighted in the plains before this," a birder said.

49.title: NRI groom, parents booked for fraud in Mohali
49.article_body: Mohali Police have booked an NRI groom and his parents for refusing to marry the woman he got engaged to in 2018. While the accused, Deepanshu Dhiman, moved to Australia, his parents kept introducing the woman to their relatives as their daughter-in-law. In 2021, another woman claiming to be in relation with Deepanshu told the woman he wouldn't marry her.

50.title: People in the West were shocked to see the real images of Kashmir: Vivek
50.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri said that the film made the West sit up and take notice. "We went from place to place and people were...shocked to see the real images of Kashmir," he added. Vivek said there has been a lot of disinformation regarding Kashmir in the West. "Nobody knows about what happened to Kashmiri Pandits," he added.

51.title: Highway project Bharatmala Pariyojana Phase-I to be delayed by 5 yrs: Govt
51.article_body: The Centre’s flagship programme for national highways, Bharatmala Pariyojana (BMP) Phase-I, which was initially proposed to be completed by 2022, will now be completed by 2027. Owing to the five-year delay, the estimated project cost has doubled from ₹5.35 lakh crore to ₹10.63 lakh crore. This information was furnished by the Union Ministry of Road Transport and Highways.

52.title: 222 kg ganja, 2 L hashish oil seized in 2 incidents in Hyd; 5 held
52.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police said on Tuesday that police have seized 222 kg of ganja and two litre of hashish oil along with other items worth a total of ₹55.5 lakh in two incidents. Four alleged drug peddlers were arrested in Bhongir in one incident, while in the other, one person was arrested in Ghatkesar for reportedly illegally transporting drugs.

53.title: Centre's letter on Delhi Metro MD appointment has loopholes: AAP govt
53.article_body: Days after the Centre wrote a letter to Delhi authorities mentioning points to consider while appointing DMRC's Managing Director, the AAP authorities said that the points mentioned have "many legal loopholes". The candidate for the Delhi Metro MD post has to be reportedly chosen earlier than March-end. Notably, the Centre and Delhi governments have an equal stake within the DMRC.

54.title: Lift collapses from 40th floor in Mumbai building; 1 dead, 1 injured
54.article_body: A 43-year-old man was killed while a 26-year-old man was injured as lift of building in Mumbai collapsed from 40th floor during repair work. Lift had not been working since two days. Both workers, who were atop lift, were removed after collapse. The injured, who reportedly had severe head injury during the incident, has been admitted to the hospital.

55.title: Fox News journalist injured, hospitalised in war-stricken Ukraine
55.article_body: A Fox News journalist, Benjamin Hall, got injured while working outside of Ukraine's Kyiv and was hospitalised, said the channel. "This is a stark reminder for all journalists who are putting their lives on the line every day to deliver the news from a war zone," added the channel. The US State Department said it was ready to help Hall.

56.title: Captaining India in Tests was a huge thing for me: Rohit Sharma
56.article_body: Rohit Sharma, who was named Team India's new Test captain ahead of the Sri Lanka Tests, has said captaining in red-ball cricket was a huge thing for him. "I've not captained much in red-ball cricket. I have done it in a few games in Ranji Trophy...team supported me a lot [against SL]," he added. India won the two-Test series 2-0.

57.title: Mumbai civic body asks Union Minister to demolish illegal addition to bungalow
57.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), while issuing a fresh notice, has asked Union Minister Narayan Rane to demolish the alleged illegal construction at his eight-storey bungalow in Juhu within 15 days. As per the notice, if the unauthorised addition is not removed within the stipulated time, the civic body will raze it and also recover demolition charges.

58.title: People who wear short, sexy dresses are judged, considered useless: Neena
58.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta took to Instagram to share a video in which she said, "People who wear short, sexy dresses are...judged and considered useless. This is not fair." "I am wearing a short dress and let me tell you...I have done many great things in life," added Neena. "Nobody must have ever scolded trolls with such love," a user commented.

59.title: Pune civic body's 1st medical college to come up under PPP model
59.article_body: The first medical college within Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) limits will come up under public-private partnership (PPP) model, Additional Municipal Commissioner (General) Ravindra Binwade said. "The share of public investment...private involvement will be explored later, given...college fulfils all required permissions," he added. "A total of 13 such colleges can be explored," Binwade stated.

60.title: AAP protests outside BJP headquarters in Delhi over 'delay' in MCD polls
60.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Monday protested outside BJP headquarters in Delhi against the alleged delay in holding Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) polls. BJP has "coerced" the Election Commission to delay polls for "political gains", AAP alleged. "I challenge BJP to make sure...MCD elections are announced in a week's time if it doesn't fear," AAP's Gopal Rai said.

61.title: Ex-Union Minister Vijay Goel's mobile phone snatched near Delhi's Jama Masjid
61.article_body: Former Union Minister and senior BJP leader Vijay Goel's phone was allegedly snatched near Jama Masjid metro station in Delhi on Monday evening, police said. The incident took place when he was travelling from Daryaganj towards Red Fort in a car and had stopped near the metro station gate. Goel was sitting in the car when his phone was snatched.

62.title: Apple supplier Foxconn in talks to build $9 bn plant in Saudi: WSJ
62.article_body: Apple supplier Foxconn and Saudi Arabia are discussing building a $9 billion facility jointly that could make microchips, EV components and other electronics, the Wall Street Journal reported. Saudi Arabia is reviewing Foxconn's offer to build a dual-line semiconductor contract manufacturing facility in Neom. Foxconn is also in talks with the UAE about potentially situating the project there.

63.title: Which records set in the first-ever Test 145 years ago are still unbroken?
63.article_body: Australia's Charles Bannerman's record for the highest percentage of runs by a batter in a completed Test innings set in the first-ever Test that started on March 15, 1877 is still unbroken. Bannerman slammed 165*, constituting 67.34% of Australia's 245. Further, England's James Southerton, who featured in the Test, is still the oldest debutant at 49 years and 119 days.

64.title: Shama Sikander marries American businessman James Milliron in Goa, shares pics
64.article_body: Actress Shama Sikander tied the knot with American businessman James Milliron in Goa on Monday. Sharing pictures from the wedding on Instagram, Shama wrote, "Whole." "Congratulations! Wishing you both a lifetime of happiness," actress Sonnalli Seygall commented on Shama's wedding pictures. Shama and James had got engaged on December 31, 2015 in Dubai.

65.title: Little devil, you're weak: Russian space chief to Musk on combat challenge to Putin
65.article_body: After Tesla CEO Elon Musk challenged Russian President Vladimir Putin to single combat, Russian space agency Roscosmos' head Dmitry Rogozin replied with a verse by Alexander Pushkin calling Musk a "little devil". Quoting the poet, Rogozin wrote, "You, little devil, are still young. You're weak to compete with me; it'd only be a waste of time. Overtake my brother first."

66.title: China sees 5,280 COVID cases for 1st time in 2 years driven by 'stealth Omicron'
66.article_body: China has reported 5,280 COVID-19 cases for the first time since the early days of the pandemic, driven by 'stealth Omicron' variant, reports said. The 'stealth Omicron' - or the BA.2 sub-variant, is 1.5 times more transmissible than the original Omicron strain, studies suggest. At least 10 cities and counties were locked down including Shenzhen, home to 17 million people.

67.title: Vivek used to hug me, we cried during 'The Kashmir Files': Anupam Kher
67.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher said that he cried a lot during and after the making of 'The Kashmir Files'. "Vivek used to hug me and we cried. It was...one of the most difficult roles to enact," he said, adding, "This was my tribute to my father...When I reached the set on first day...actor took back seat...person had to take front seat."

68.title: Manjrekar's old tweet on Pant's keeping resurfaces after he wins Player of Series award
68.article_body: An old tweet by Sanjay Manjrekar on Rishabh Pant's wicketkeeping has resurfaced after the 24-year-old became the first Indian wicketkeeper-batter to win Player of the Series award in Test cricket. Referring to a missed stumping during India's Test series against England, Manjrekar had tweeted that Pant's mistake "tells me all I need to know about Pant the keeper".

69.title: You can't lie to your children: Sunny on protecting her kids from media reports
69.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone said she'd be honest with her children in order to protect them from negative reports about her and her husband Daniel Weber. She added, "I'd be...crazy if I didn't think...it would happen. But I think...communication is going to be the best tool." "You can't lie to your children, they're going to find out the truth," Sunny said.

70.title: Pune housing societies protest over water supply, sewage problems
70.article_body: Anandvan Parisar Residents Forum (APRF), an informal association of 25 housing societies, has staged a protest over issues related to water supply, sewage system and roads in Pune's NIBM area. "All the residents of the area are facing hardship in commuting and the burden of paying for water tankers," an APRF official said. The protest was held on Sunday.

71.title: It was nothing other than an accident: US on Indian missile landing in Pakistan
71.article_body: After India accidentally fired a missile that landed in Pakistan, the US said, "We have no indication as you also heard from our Indian partners that this incident was anything other than an accident." "We refer you of course to the Indian Ministry of Defense for any follow up. We don't have a comment beyond that," the US further said.

72.title: Over 5,800 people booked in 2 months for drinking in public in Delhi
72.article_body: The Delhi Police has booked over 5,800 persons under the Excise Act for allegedly consuming liquor at public places in the city. According to data released by senior police officers, over 2,489 persons were booked under the Delhi Police Act and 1,242 were booked under IPC section 290 (public nuisance). "We call these people 'open drinkers'," said a police official.

73.title: 3 teens drown in MP, CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia for families
73.article_body: Three teens, aged between 15 and 17, drowned while taking a bath near Udaigiri dam in Madhya Pradesh's Vidisha on Sunday. The bodies of two youths were retrieved while the search for the third is underway, an official said on Monday. Meanwhile, an ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh for the family of each deceased has been announced by the CM.

74.title: TN girl dies by suicide after being told to stand outside class
74.article_body: A Class 9 student died by suicide in Tamil Nadu's Tiruchengode on Saturday, after being made to stand outside for coming late to class. The girl complained of a vomiting sensation after entering the class and went out, an official said. The teacher asked the students to check on her, but the girl had taken the extreme step by then.

75.title: RS gets ultraviolet radiation equipment to contain COVID-19 spread
75.article_body: Ultraviolet C-band radiation equipment has been installed in Rajya Sabha chambers to contain the spread of coronavirus, Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu informed on Monday. Speaking on the first day of the second part of the Budget Session, Naidu added that the recently installed equipment "is very effective in killing the virus." The technology has been developed by CSIR-CSIO.

76.title: Female lawyer attacked with acid in Punjab, escapes unharmed
76.article_body: A female lawyer escaped unharmed after being attacked with acid by two bike-borne men in Punjab's Amritsar. According to reports, the woman was returning home with her brother when the men approached her. One of them sprinkled acid on her but she immediately managed to cover her face with a jacket. Police have registered a case under relevant IPC sections.

77.title: Yellow alert issued for heat wave in Gujarat for next 2 days: IMD
77.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Monday issued a 'yellow' alert for Gujarat for the next two days as the heatwave intensifies in India. "The temperature might rise around 1-2° C and a severe heatwave is expected in Saurashtra and Gujarat regions. The temperature in Ahmedabad is expected [to be] around 40-41° C," said Manorama Mohanty, Director, Meteorological Centre Ahmedabad.

78.title: Chennai Corporation using drones to spray larvicide in water bodies
78.article_body: The Greater Chennai Corporation has started using drones to spray mosquito larvicide in order to prevent the breeding of mosquitoes in water bodies. Corporation Commissioner Gagandeep Singh Bedi said two drones are used every day to spray approximately 400 litres of chemicals. He added it was part of the 15 days of anti-larvae chemical spray project started by the corporation.

79.title: Want to take TMC's 'Khela hobe' slogan across India: Shatrughan
79.article_body: Actor and former Union Minister Shatrughan Sinha, who has been announced as TMC's Asansol candidate for Lok Sabha by-election, said on Monday that he wants to take his party's slogan 'Khela hobe' (Game is on) across the country. He further dismissed the Opposition's allegation of him being an "outsider", saying, "I'm no less a Bengali than any other Bengali."

80.title: IMDb changes rating system for 'The Kashmir Files' after 'unusual voting activity'
80.article_body: Film and television review hosting website IMDb has changed its rating system after it "detected unusual voting activity" on 'The Kashmir Files' page. The movie's ratings allegedly dipped after the system change, after which director Vivek Agnihotri said, "This is unusual and unethical." The movie's rating currently stands at 8.3/10, with 2,36,000 votes recorded.

81.title: Face masks of PM in high demand ahead of Holi in UP's Prayagraj
81.article_body: Ahead of Holi, markets in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj are witnessing a high demand for PM Narendra Modi's face masks. According to the shopkeepers, BJP's victory in the Assembly elections has given a boost to the demand for PM Modi's masks. "This year Holi will be celebrated with saffron colour," said a shopkeeper in Prayagraj.

82.title: Man rapes 13-yr-old girl repeatedly on pretext of marriage in Guj
82.article_body: Ahmedabad's Ghatlodia Police on Sunday filed a complaint against a 26-year-old man for allegedly raping a 13-year-old girl repeatedly on the pretext of marrying her, reports said. The accused befriended the girl about a year ago and lured her with money and the pretext of marriage, police said. The accused eloped with the girl six months ago, police added.

83.title: Sec 144 in Kalaburagi, Hassan & other K'taka districts ahead of hijab row verdict
83.article_body: Prohibitory orders under CrPC section 144 have been imposed in Karnataka's Bengaluru, Belagavi, Davanagere, Hassan, Kalaburagi and Shivamogga as the High Court will deliver its judgment on hijab ban issue on Tuesday. A ban on gatherings and protests has been imposed in Bengaluru from March 15-March 21. Schools and colleges in Dakshina Kannada and Udupi will remain closed on Tuesday.

84.title: Philippines summons Chinese envoy over navy ship's intrusion
84.article_body: Philippine government summoned Chinese ambassador Huang Xilian on Monday to explain the "illegal intrusion" of a Chinese naval ship into the country's waters. In a statement, Philippine Foreign Ministry said the ship remained in their waters from January 29 to February 1. The government also demanded that Beijing must order its ships to respect Philippine territory and follow international law.

85.title: Channi's greed pulled party down, he's a liability: Cong leader
85.article_body: Following the Congress' defeat in Punjab Assembly elections, former state Congress chief Sunil Jakhar on Monday called Charanjit Singh Channi a "liability" whose "greed pulled the party down". "An asset, are you joking? Thank God he wasn't declared a 'National Treasure' at Congress Working Committee by the 'PBI' lady who proposed him as CM in the first place," he said.

86.title: India's pink, white, red ball form at home in 2022 is outstanding: Sachin
86.article_body: Congratulating India after their pink-ball Test win against Sri Lanka in Bengaluru, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Team India's pink, white...red ball form at home this season has been outstanding." India won red-ball Test against Sri Lanka in Mohali and white-ball (T20I) series against them in Lucknow and Dharamshala. India beat West Indies in white-ball series in Ahmedabad and Kolkata in February.

87.title: Pant becomes first Indian wicketkeeper to win Player of the Series award in Test cricket
87.article_body: Rishabh Pant has become the first Indian wicketkeeper-batter to win Player of the Series award in Test cricket. He was named Player of the Series for scoring 185 runs in the two-match series against Sri Lanka. He had a batting average of 61.66 and strike rate of 120.12 in the series. Pant took five catches and effected three stumpings.

88.title: Farmers to launch protest from March 21 against govt's 'broken promises'
88.article_body: The Samyukt Kisan Morcha on Monday decided to launch a nationwide agitation from March 21 to protest the Centre's 'broken promises' on the issue of forming a panel on MSP. The agitation will be launched in phases and during the second phase from April 11-17, farmers will observe 'MSP guarantee week'. The agitation was earlier suspended on December 9, 2021.

89.title: China's richest billionaires lose over $52 billion in a day as stocks plunge
89.article_body: The combined net worth of China's 78 richest tycoons fell by over $52 billion in a day as Chinese stocks plunged on Monday. Bottled water company Nongfu Spring's Founder and the country's richest person Zhong Shanshan lost the most, with his fortune declining by $5 billion. Tencent's Pony Ma saw his net worth drop by $3.3 billion to $35.2 billion.

90.title: Empire Magazine releases still of Scarlet Witch from Doctor Strange 2
90.article_body: Elizabeth Olsen's new still as Scarlet Witch in the upcoming film 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' has been released by the Empire Magazine. The film will also feature Benedict Cumberbatch, who will play Doctor Strange in the film. 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness', directed by Sam Raimi, is expected to have cameos by MCU characters.

91.title: I rejoined politics because of Mamata Banerjee: TMC's Babul Supriyo
91.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Babul Supriyo said on Monday that he rejoined politics because party supremo and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee asked him to work for the state. Supriyo's remark came after the TMC declared him as its candidate in the Assembly by-election from Ballygunge seat. Supriyo had resigned as Union Minister and BJP's MP from Asansol in 2021.

92.title: Kyiv Mayor in selfie video shows damage caused by Russian forces in Ukraine
92.article_body: In a selfie video, Kyiv’s Mayor Vitali Klitschko showed the damage caused in Ukraine amid the ongoing war with Russia. In the clip, Klitschko said, “That's what Russians' war against civilians looks like. Destroyed buildings, destroyed infrastructure...Lives are getting lost." Sharing the video, he also wrote, "Putin's dream of creating a Greater Russia is my country's nightmare."

93.title: I knew only two words in English when I first arrived in Bombay: Anil Agarwal
93.article_body: Anil Agarwal, the 68-year-old billionaire Executive Chairman of Vedanta Resources, tweeted, "When I first arrived in Bombay, I knew only two words in English, 'yes' and 'no'." He said, "I held on to my dreams of making it big." He added, "I came to know a cable company was on the brink of bankruptcy...I started dreaming about acquiring that company."

94.title: 700 primary schools in Gujarat managed by 1 teacher each, says govt
94.article_body: As many as 700 government primary schools in Gujarat are run by a single teacher each, who teaches from classes 1 to 8, said the state government's data tabled in the Gujarat Legislature on Monday. Kutch has 100 such schools with one teacher each. Mahisagar has 74 such schools and Tapi has 59 schools, as per the data.

95.title: 'No Time To Die' film editors criticise Oscars for broadcast cuts
95.article_body: 'No Time To Die' editors Tom Cross and Elliot Graham, who won Best Editing at BAFTA Awards 2022, have criticised the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences for cutting eight categories, including Best Film Editing, from the live telecast plans. "All of those nominees...deserve to stand up...same way everyone else does," Cross stated. Graham added, "It's f****d up."

96.title: ED attached wrong properties of ex-Amrapali Director: Auditor to SC
96.article_body: Forensic auditor Pawan Agarwala told the Supreme Court that the Enforcement Directorate has attached wrong properties of Amrapali Group's ex-Director Prem Mishra. These properties need to be detached and auctioned off to generate funds for stalled projects' construction, Agarwala said. SC had directed ED to investigate alleged money laundering by realtors, including Amrapali Group.

97.title: HC to deliver judgment on hijab ban tomorrow, section 144 imposed in B'luru
97.article_body: The Karnataka HC will deliver its judgment on the hijab ban issue on Tuesday and section 144 was imposed in Bengaluru from March 15-March 21, banning all types of gatherings and protests. The protests in the state began in January after some Muslim girl students in the Udupi district alleged that they were banned from attending classes while wearing hijab.

98.title: Himanshu continues shooting for 'Aggar Tum Na Hote' despite injury
98.article_body: Himanshu Soni, who is the lead actor in 'Aggar Tum Na Hote', has continued shooting for the serial despite suffering a back injury on the set. "I have in fact been advised bed rest for two months, but as the main character...I know how important it is for me to be present for each scene," he added.

99.title: Made mistakes in past, but learning every day: Pant on Player of Series win
99.article_body:
On being asked which aspect of his game (batting or wicketkeeping) satisfies him more, India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant said, "Both of them...because, as a cricketer, you want to evolve." He added, "I've made a few mistakes in the past, but I'm learning each and every day."
Pant was adjudged 'Player of the Series' in India-Sri Lanka two-match Test series.

100.title: Irish Aviation Authority revokes permits of Russian-operated planes
100.article_body: Irish Aviation Authority on Monday revoked certificates of airworthiness for all Russian-operated planes registered in the country amid the war between Russia and Ukraine. Reportedly, no plane is allowed to fly without the certificate. This comes after Bermuda Civil Aviation Authority also suspended certification of all Russian-operated planes on March 12 amid international sanctions over the war.

101.title: Moscow mayor ends requirement to use protective masks from March 15
101.article_body: Moscow mayor Sergei Sobyanin on Monday ended the requirement to use protective masks in public starting Tuesday, March 15. Citing improving COVID-19 situation in the Russian capital, Sobyanin added companies won't have to ensure anti-COVID-19 measures such as temperature checks and social distancing. Meanwhile the country reported 41,055 cases in last 24 hours with Moscow logging 957 infections.

102.title: 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' lovely film, Alia blessed with talent: Karthi
102.article_body: Tamil actor Karthi on Monday took to Twitter to appreciate Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' calling it a lovely film. He tweeted that actress Alia Bhatt is blessed with great talent, writing, "She erupts, melts and shines without losing the innocence." Karthi further wrote that the film is opulent and rich with aesthetics, adding that it is very special.

103.title: UK will continue supplying weapons to Ukraine: PM's spokesman
103.article_body: The UK will continue providing weapons to Ukraine, PM Boris Johnson's spokesman said on Monday. "We will absolutely carry on providing this...lethal capability to the Ukrainian government...We know it has been helpful," he added. The comments came after Russia launched missile strikes at a Ukrainian military base near Poland's border on Sunday, which the UK has termed "deeply concerning".

104.title: I wanted to show truth to whole world: Vivek on 'The Kashmir Files'
104.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri has said that he made the film because he wanted to show the truth to the whole world. "I wanted to make a sensitive film that has universal resonance," the filmmaker added. He further said he was inspired by Hollywood to make films that praise the country and present its greatness to the world.

105.title: He can send Putin to Jupiter: Ukraine Vice PM on 'Musk-Putin fight' tweet
105.article_body: Ukraine's Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov while reacting to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's tweet calling for single combat with Russian President Vladimir Putin, wrote that the former can send Putin to Jupiter. Earlier today, the world's richest man Musk tweeted, "I hereby challenge Vladimir Putin to single combat...Stakes are Ukraine." Musk also tweeted to ask if Putin agreed to the fight.

106.title: AAP to contest 2023 panchayat polls in Bengal: State party in charge
106.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) will contest the 2023 panchayat elections in West Bengal, state party in charge Sanjoy Basu confirmed on Monday. Basu added that the party has commenced its campaign in the state. Notably, AAP held a victory rally in Kolkata on Sunday to celebrate its win in the recently-concluded Punjab Assembly elections.

107.title: International kabaddi player Sandeep Nangal shot dead during tournament in Punjab
107.article_body: International kabaddi player Sandeep Nangal was shot dead on Monday by unidentified assailants during a kabaddi tournament in Malian village in Punjab's Jalandhar, police said. Around eight to 10 bullets were fired at him as per the police. As per reports, the bullets hit his head and chest.

108.title: Shreyas Iyer and Amelia Kerr named ICC Players of the Month for February
108.article_body: ICC today announced that India batter Shreyas Iyer and New Zealand Women all-rounder Amelia Kerr were voted ICC Players of the Month in men's and women's category respectively for February 2022. In February, Iyer had won Player of the Series award for scoring three unbeaten T20I fifties against Sri Lanka. Kerr had finished top-run scorer in ODI series against India.

109.title: Air India has 2,657 pending cases in Indian and international courts: Govt
109.article_body: Air India has 2,657 cases pending against it in Indian and international courts, VK Singh, the Minister of State for Civil Aviation, informed Rajya Sabha on Monday. These cases related to issues such as employee service matters, consumer complaints and commercial matters. "These cases are against Air India as a legal entity and will remain with Air India," Singh said.

110.title: AI & Robotics Tech Park launched at IISc B'luru with ₹230 cr seed fund
110.article_body: An Artificial Intelligence and Robotics Technology Park (ARTPARK) has been launched at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) in Bengaluru with a seed capital of ₹230 crore from the Centre and the Karnataka government. "ARTPARK has been set up to effectively use technology, specifically AI and robotics, for the country's betterment," Karnataka's Minister for IT-BT, CN Ashwathnarayan, said.

111.title: Video captures moment when missile strikes & explodes in Ukraine street
111.article_body: A video has surfaced online that showed how a missile exploded in the middle of a street in Ukraine while a man escaped seconds before its explosion. In the clip, the man can be seen walking along the street when the missile strikes through the air and explodes. It reportedly destroyed a tram and hit part of a residential building.

112.title: Over 2,500 Mariupol civilians killed since Russia invaded: Ukraine
112.article_body: Over 2,500 civilians were killed in Mariupol since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24, said Alexey Arestovich, advisor to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday. One of the worst-hit cities, Mariupol saw destruction of several of its civilian facilities including a children's hospital since the war began. Meanwhile, UN said over 2.8 million Ukrainians have fled their homeland so far.

113.title: Berlin warns refugees from Ukraine about human trafficking danger
113.article_body: Germany's Berlin has warned refugees from Ukraine against accepting monetary or accommodation offers at city's main train station amid concerns of human trafficking. "There may be criminals on the move at Berlin central station who want to profit from...situation of war refugees," Berlin government said. Nearly 1,47,000 Ukrainian refugees have registered in Germany so far, German government said.

114.title: Hope to maintain consistency ahead: Shreyas on his 92, 67 in 2nd Test
114.article_body: After winning 'Player of the Match' award in India's 238-run win against Sri Lanka in second Test, India batter Shreyas Iyer said he hopes he can maintain the consistency in future. Shreyas hit 92 and 67, top-scoring for India in both the innings. Earlier, Shreyas was adjudged 'Player of the Series' in India's 3-0 T20I series win against Sri Lanka.

115.title: UN launches final talks on global biodiversity framework in Geneva
115.article_body: UN on Monday launched its final talks to strike a deal on the global biodiversity framework in Geneva, Switzerland. Representatives from 164 countries will discuss over an international pact to safeguard nature and protect vulnerable species with a target of conserving 30% of countries' territory by 2030. The talks are slated to be held from March 14 to 29.

116.title: How does the WTC points table read after India's victory against Sri Lanka?
116.article_body: India jumped to fourth spot on World Test Championship (WTC) points table after completing a 2-0 series whitewash against Sri Lanka. India are fourth with 58.33% of points won, while Sri Lanka are fifth with 50% of points won. England are last on the table with 11.67% of points won, while Australia are on top with 77.77% of points won.

117.title: It was surprising, I wasn't asked to audition: Shabana Azmi on 'Halo'
117.article_body: Veteran actress Shabana Azmi, who will be seen in upcoming series 'Halo', said that the role was surprising for her as she wasn't asked to audition. She added that her agent was in talks with the producers without letting her know. "It was only after I got confirmed that I had my first facetime call with the director," Shabana said.

118.title: Shreyas knew he was stepping into big shoes of Rahane, Pujara: Rohit
118.article_body: Talking about Shreyas Iyer, who top-scored for India with 92 and 67 in Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka, India captain Rohit Sharma said Shreyas knew he was stepping into "big shoes" of Ajinkya Rahane and Cheteshwar Pujara. "He has everything that he requires," he added. The 27-year-old batter was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in India's 238-run win in Bengaluru.

119.title: 15 dead in Bihar after consuming spurious alcohol
119.article_body: A total of 15 people were killed in Bihar after they drank spurious alcohol, police said. Bhagalpur and Gopalganj districts reported six and nine deaths respectively while two more people have been admitted to hospitals in Gorakhpur and Bhagalpur. Police has arrested five people from Bhagalpur for supplying illicit liquor during a marriage party.

120.title: This marks another year of your brilliance: Ajay on Rohit's birthday
120.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn took to Twitter and wished filmmaker Rohit Shetty on his birthday. "Our collaborations have always left me thrilled, ROFL-ing and pumped for more! This marks another year of your brilliance, hard work and creativity. Happy birthday, my friend," Ajay wrote. The duo has worked together in several projects like the 'Golmaal' series, 'Zameen' and 'Singham'.

121.title: Shah Rukh's old video on 'futility of war' goes viral amid Russia-Ukraine war
121.article_body: Amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine, an old video where Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan is talking about the "futility of war", has gone viral online. "Only the dead have seen the end of war. Nobody knows when a war's going to end. It only ends for the guys who've died...War isn't an alternative to peace, goodness," said Shah Rukh.

122.title: 'Musk-Putin's fight will be over in 10 secs' says Twitter user; Musk says 'pretty much'
122.article_body: Elon Musk responded "pretty much" to a Twitter user who claimed Musk and Russian President Vladimir Putin's "fight" would be over in 10 seconds. The user said, "It'd just depend on how much damage Elon would want to do (and) how fast. Nothing else...Elon is also 19 years younger." This comes after Musk challenged Putin to single combat for Ukraine.

123.title: Video captures moment when missile strikes & explodes in Ukraine street
123.article_body: CCTV footage captured the moment when a missile hit a street in Ukraine’s Kyiv. In the clip, a person can be seen walking along the street when a missile strikes through the air, smashes on the road leading to an explosion. The explosion reportedly destroyed a tram and hit part of a residential building.

124.title: I'm not in a rush to appear in B'wood films, I can wait: Pooja Hedge
124.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde in an interview said that she is not in a rush to appear in Bollywood films and doesn't fear losing out on visibility. "No, I can wait...It is a blessing that the audience has accepted me in every region," the actress added. Pooja further said that people earlier only complimented her screen presence and beauty.

125.title: Greek PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis tests positive for COVID-19
125.article_body: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis on Monday said he tested positive for COVID-19 through a video message on Instagram. "I tested positive this morning and therefore will isolate at home and work from there," stated Mitsotakis. This comes after Mitsotakis held talks over the war in Ukraine with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan in Istanbul on Sunday.

126.title: Janhvi will be brilliant in 'Mili', can't wait to watch her: Anna
126.article_body: Malayalam actress Anna Ben said actress Janhvi Kapoor will be brilliant in the film 'Mili' and added she can't wait to watch her in it. 'Mili' is a Hindi remake of Anna's 2019 Malayalam film 'Helen'. "I'm...excited for Mili because Mathukutty (Xavier) has directed the film in Hindi as well," she stated. The film stars Manoj Pahwa and Sunny Kaushal.

127.title: How to lose elections can be learned from Congress: Anurag Thakur
127.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur while referring to Congress' defeat in the recently-concluded state Assembly elections said that "how to lose elections" should be learned from the party. He said, "There was no anti-incumbency in any of the states" adding that the clean image and good work of the Chief Ministers also led to their victory.

128.title: To me, it's all life: Russian influencer's crying video after Instagram ban goes viral
128.article_body: After Russia banned Instagram, a video of a crying Russian Instagram influencer is being widely shared on social media. In the clip, she said, "Do you think that for me, as an Instagram influencer, this is [a] source of income? To me, it’s [Instagram] just all life, it’s the soul. It’s the one with which I wake up, fall asleep."

129.title: Ukraine to launch NFT collection depicting the Russia-Ukraine war
129.article_body: The Ukrainian government will launch an NFT collection to depict the story of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Deputy Digital Transformation Minister Alexander Bornyakov said. The collection will be "like a museum of the Russia-Ukraine war". He added that each NFT art would represent a story from the war and would be backed with a reliable news source.

130.title: It shows where Pak cricket is at: Taylor on pitches in Pak-Aus Tests
130.article_body: Talking about the pitches used in Rawalpindi and Karachi for the first two Pakistan-Australia Tests, ex-Australia captain Mark Taylor said, "Unfortunately...it shows where Pakistan cricket is at." Taylor stated pitches used in Rawalpindi and Karachi are roads and added, "They are hard, you can see there's not much grass on them." He added he would've loved to see good pitches.

131.title: Feel good series win: Irfan on India's 2-0 series whitewash vs Sri Lanka
131.article_body: Following India's 2-0 series whitewash against Sri Lanka after winning the second Test by 238 runs in Bengaluru, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan tweeted, "Feel good series win by Team India." He added, "Not a single win during this Indian trip for Sri Lanka, they need to learn a lot quickly." Earlier, India beat Sri Lanka 3-0 in three-match T20I series.

132.title: No plan to make it mandatory for airlines to play Indian music: Govt
132.article_body: Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh on Monday said that the government is not planning to make it mandatory for airlines and airports to play Indian music in their flights and terminal premises. On December 27, the Ministry of Civil Aviation had asked all airlines and airports to consider playing Indian music in their flights and terminals.

133.title: Wind power generation to rise nearly 70% by 2024 in Sweden: Govt
133.article_body: Swedish Energy Agency, a state-run body on Monday said wind power generation in Sweden is expected to rise by about 70% by 2024. As per the agency, wind power generation is expected to rise from 27.4 terawatt hours (TWh) in 2021 to 46.9 TWh in 2024. The report added hydropower and nuclear energy will remain the country's largest power sources.

134.title: Turkey's Erdogan, Germany's Scholz to hold talks over Ukraine today
134.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz will hold talks over the war in Ukraine in Ankara on Monday, said Erdogan's office. As per the statement by the presidency, the two nations will discuss bilateral ties and Turkey-EU relations. The talks come as both countries work towards a ceasefire between Russia and Ukraine.

135.title: Kim's boyfriend Pete Davidson to fly to space on Blue Origin's next flight
135.article_body: Comedian Pete Davidson, who's currently dating socialite Kim Kardashian, will fly to the edge of space on billionaire Jeff Bezos-led Blue Origin's upcoming spaceflight. The space tourism company's fourth human flight is scheduled for March 23 and will carry five other customers. In October last year, 'Star Trek' actor William Shatner flew to space aboard Blue Origin's New Shepard rocket.

136.title: Whenever I drank alcohol I'd down an entire bottle, that wasn't okay: Aamir
136.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said in an interview that he used to drink occasionally earlier, but doesn't anymore. He said, "I was never one of those who drank regularly...but whenever I did...drink, I would down the entire bottle. I felt that that was not okay." Khan added that not being under his own control "didn't sit well" with him.

137.title: Craze of game is very high: Bumrah on security breach by fans in 2nd Test
137.article_body: Reacting to fans breaching security to click pictures with Virat Kohli on Day 2 of India-Sri Lanka second Test at M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru, India Test vice-captain Jasprit Bumrah said, "That's something we don't control." He added, "Obviously, security concern is an issue...craze for the game is very high and...fans get emotional sometimes." Two fans clicked selfies with Kohli.

138.title: Bank frauds fell from ₹61,229 cr in FY17 to ₹648 cr in Apr-Dec 2021: Govt
138.article_body: Bank frauds recorded a sharp decline over the past five years to ₹648 crore in the first nine months of FY22, Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad said on Monday. They stood at ₹61,229 crore in FY17 and at ₹11,583 crore in FY21. According to Karad, improved detection and reporting along with comprehensive steps resulted in the decline.

139.title: Had sex with my mother's friend, she was divorced: Shivam Sharma
139.article_body: Actor-model Shivam Sharma, who is a contestant on reality show 'Lock Upp', has revealed that he used to have sex with his mother's friend during his college days. "It isn't dirty because she was a divorcee and I wanted to help with her sexual life," he added. Shivam said that it's called 'pyaar do, pyaar lo' (give love, take love).

140.title: Maggi, coffee, tea to get costlier as Nestlé, HUL hike prices: Report
140.article_body: Nestlé products like Maggi noodles, Nescafé coffee and Hindustan Unilever Ltd's (HUL) BRU coffee, Taj Mahal tea and Brooke Bond tea will get costlier as the two companies have increased the prices of some of their products, CNBC-TV18 reported on Monday. Maggi noodles are set to get costlier by 9-16%, it added. Taj Mahal tea prices were hiked by 3.7-5.8%.

141.title: I want to speak to, entertain maximum number of people: Ayushmann
141.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana has stated that as an artist, he wants to speak to and entertain the maximum number of people through his brand of cinema. "I like to pick subjects that unify people making movies a community watching experience," he added. Ayushmann further said that some of the best times he's had at movies have been with his family.

142.title: France lifts mask mandate, other COVID-19 curbs on unvaccinated
142.article_body: France lifted several of its COVID-19 restrictions, including the mask mandate for most settings, on Monday. Wearing masks is no longer required in schools, businesses and offices, but remains mandatory on public transportation and other healthcare facilities. Additionally, people do not need to present proof of vaccination to enter venues, including cinemas, sports arenas, restaurants and bars.

143.title: WWE legend Razor Ramon suffers 3 heart attacks, put on life support
143.article_body: WWE Hall of Famer Scott Hall, popularly known as Razor Ramon, has suffered three heart attacks after a blood clot went loose following his hip surgery last week. Ramon is currently on life support at the Wellstar Kennestone Hospital in Marietta, Georgia. Ramon was hospitalised a little over a week ago after he fell and broke his hip.

144.title: China building 6,000-bed hospital in 6 days as COVID-19 resurges
144.article_body: A 6,000-bed makeshift hospital is under construction in China's Jilin City to cope with a resurgence of COVID-19 as China battles its worst COVID-19 outbreak in two years. The 6,000-bed facility is expected to be completed within six days, reported Xinhua. Jilin province recorded over 1,000 new cases for the second day in a row, on Monday.

145.title: Half-day in T'gana schools from March 15 amid rising temperature
145.article_body: All schools in Telangana will have half-day for students from March 15 (Tuesday) amid rising temperatures in the state. As per an order issued by the Telangana Directorate of School Education, the schools will remain open from 8 am to 12.30 pm. However, special classes shall continue for Class 10 students preparing for the upcoming SSC public examination.

146.title: Took us 32 yrs & film to get to know truth: Yami on 'The Kashmir...'
146.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam, speaking about the film 'The Kashmir Files', has said, "Being married to a Kashmiri Pandit, I know first hand of the atrocities...this peace-loving community has gone through." "It took us 32 years and a film to get to know the truth," she added. Yami is married to filmmaker Aditya Dhar, who directed 'Uri: The Surgical Strike'.

147.title: Kapp's an inspiration for young players: SA's Luus after win vs Eng
147.article_body: Following a three-wicket win over England in the Women's ODI World Cup, South Africa captain Sune Luus called her teammate Marizanne Kapp an inspiration for young players. Kapp claimed a five-wicket haul in the match and restricted England to 235 runs. In reply, South Africa chased the target with four balls to spare. Kapp was adjudged Player of the Match.

148.title: Unfair to Pakistan bowlers: Inzamam on pitches being used in Pak-Aus Tests
148.article_body: Amid the criticism over the pitches being used in ongoing Pakistan-Australia Test series, ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said he requests Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairman Ramiz Raja to work on the groundsmen and pitch curators. "Pakistan's bowlers are good and have won matches for their side which is why it is unfair to treat them like this," added Inzamam.

149.title: People run for cover as waterspout turns into tornado at US beach, videos surface
149.article_body: Videos have surfaced online that showed a waterspout turning into a tornado at a beach in Florida, US. One of the clips showed people on the beach screaming and running for cover as it hurled towards them. Authorities confirmed that the tornado had peak winds of around 65 mph. Reports said there was no loss of life due to it.

150.title: You expect chicken biryani in veg hotel? 'Radhe Shyam' director on criticism
150.article_body: 'Radhe Shyam' director Radha Krishna Kumar has responded to critics panning the film for its lack of action, saying, "You go to a vegetarian hotel expecting them to serve chicken biriyani?" He further said that it doesn't make any sense since he had always said that the film will be a love story. 'Radhe Shyam' stars Prabhas and Pooja Hegde.

151.title: Russian attack near Poland border aimed at creating panic: Polish PM
151.article_body: Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki has said that Russia's missile attack on a Ukrainian military base near Poland's border on Sunday was aimed at creating panic among civilians. "A missile attack just 20 km from our border shows how Russia operates," Morawiecki said at a joint conference with his Ukrainian and Lithuanian counterparts. Notably, Poland is a NATO member country.

152.title: It has always been part of sport: Murray on Osaka being heckled
152.article_body: Expressing his sympathy for Naomi Osaka after she was reduced to tears by a heckler during her second-round loss on Saturday night at Indian Wells Masters, Andy Murray said he "feels for Osaka". He added that heckling has always been part of the sport. The four-time Grand Slam champion was upset by a crowd member shouting "Naomi, you suck".

153.title: Scientists create material that could make lighter, stronger vehicles
153.article_body: US scientists have created a new lightweight, shock-absorbing material that could help make lighter but stronger helmets, automobiles and aerospace parts. Researchers used Liquid Crystal Elastomers (LCEs) to increase the material's ability to hold strikes. Team observed that the material withstands impact from objects weighing about 1.8 to 6.8 kilograms coming at speeds of about 35.4 kilometres.

154.title: Senior citizens, students & COVID-19 warriors honoured at Pune event
154.article_body: Senior citizens, girl students and female COVID-19 warriors were felicitated at an event organised by Kasarwadi Citizens Forum in Pune on Women's Day. An MBA student who donated plasma for COVID-19 patients, a driver's daughter who secured 92% marks in an exam and a nurse who survived COVID-19 after six months in intensive care were among those honoured.

155.title: Home interiors delivered in 45 days or we pay you rent: HomeLane
155.article_body: HomeLane, a home interior solutions brand has unveiled its "Guaranteed" campaign, aiming to communicate delivery of personalised home interiors within 45* days and with no hidden costs. The company states, in case of unsuccessful on-time delivery, HomeLane will pay rent for everyday of delay*. As a special offer, HomeLane is also giving flat 30% off* on woodwork till 25th March.

156.title: Gandhis alone not responsible for Cong's loss in 5 states: Kharge
156.article_body: Senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge has said that during the Congress Working Committee meeting on Sunday, party chief Sonia Gandhi was told that she alone isn't responsible for Congress' defeat in five states. "Every state leader and MP is responsible, not the Gandhi family," Kharge added. "We reposed our faith in her, there's no question of offering resignation," he said.

157.title: Wanted gangster involved in supplying illegal guns arrested in Delhi
157.article_body: A wanted gangster, who was involved in supplying illegal guns and other weapons in Delhi, was arrested in Civil Lines and police recovered four pistols and over 30 bullets. Deputy Commissioner of Police (special cell) Pramod Singh Kushwah said the accused was listed as one of the top 10 wanted criminals by Meerut Police since February 2021.

158.title: Class 10 girl stabbed 4 times by 21-yr-old at school farewell in Pune
158.article_body: A class 10 student was allegedly stabbed at least four times by a 21-year-old at her school farewell in Pune on Monday, officials said. "He has stabbed her in the back, in the stomach, and cut the vein in her hand," said Imran Shaikh, a friend of the child's father. He escaped with another person on a two-wheeler, he added.

159.title: 3 women among 4 arrested for kidnapping 45-day-old infant in Delhi
159.article_body: Delhi Police on Saturday arrested four people, including three women, for allegedly kidnapping a 45-day-old infant girl from a shanty in Delhi's Punjabi Bagh, police said on Sunday. The woman "dragged" her neighbour, Bhawna, to the police station, alleging that she and her accomplices kidnapped her daughter, said a senior police officer. Police rescued the infant within a few hours.

160.title: Man tries to kill friend by handing him bag of explosives in Noida
160.article_body: Police arrested a 25-year-old man, who allegedly tried to kill his friend by handing him a bag of homemade explosives at a local market in Noida sector 63. The accused, identified as Ram Subek, started learning how to make explosives to take revenge after the victim, who lived with him, took a job from which he was fired.

161.title: Under-construction building collapses near Delhi's Kashmere Gate
161.article_body: A multi-storey under-construction building collapsed at Nicholson Road near Delhi's Kashmere Gate on Monday. According to the Delhi Fire Service, several people are feared trapped under the building rubble. "So far, eight persons have been rescued. All were workers on the site," said DCP (North) Sagar Kalsi.

162.title: After World Championships, Lovlina and Nikhat secure Asian Games selection
162.article_body: Olympic bronze-medallist Lovlina Borgohain and former junior world champion Nikhat Zareen on Monday were selected in the Indian women's boxing squad for 2022 Asian Games after winning their selection trial finals in 69kg and 51kg weight division respectively. Nikhat and Lovlina also qualified for World Championships in 52kg and 70kg categories respectively. Asian Games will begin on September 10.

163.title: Australia to replace suspended Russia in Billie Jean King Cup Finals
163.article_body: Australia will replace the suspended Russian contingent in the Billie Jean King Cup Finals, International Tennis Federation (ITF) said. Australia were the highest-ranked side among the losing semi-finalists last year and will now feature in the Finals in November. Russia were banned from defending their Billie Jean King Cup title following their invasion of Ukraine.

164.title: 7-time Super Bowl champ Brady comes back from retirement 6 weeks after quitting
164.article_body: Seven-time Super Bowl champion Tom Brady has decided to come out of retirement, six weeks after initially retiring from the sport. He will now feature for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in his 23rd NFL season. "These past two months I've realised my place is still on the field and not in the stands," the 44-year-old tweeted.

165.title: Man arrested by Mumbai Police in cheating case dies in hospital
165.article_body: Amol Sonawane, a 38-year-old man arrested in a cheating case by Mumbai's Pant Nagar Police on Thursday, died in hospital on Sunday after falling ill. A senior officer said that Sonawane was found fit in a medical test that was done before his arrest. He added Sonawane was taken to hospital on Thursday before being admitted on Saturday.

166.title: Afghan embassy in Washington DC to close down this week: US
166.article_body: US state department official on Saturday confirmed the cash-strapped Afghanistan's embassy in the country will shut down this week. The official added the diplomats are now left with a month to apply for residency in the US before being deported. This comes less than six months after US pulled out of Afghanistan as Taliban took over the country.

167.title: Knew it was going to be drawn Test: Wasim Akram on 1st Pak-Aus Test
167.article_body: Wasim Akram said he tried watching the two Test matches between Pakistan and Australia, but couldn't. "As an ex-fast bowler I knew this would be a draw match after the second delivery of the match," Akram said about the Rawalpindi Test. "If you want to make slow pitches at least make it a turner so...we get...result-oriented match," he stated.

168.title: Always with you: Suarez to Messi, Neymar on being booed by PSG fans
168.article_body: Atletico Madrid forward Luis Suarez has supported his former Barcelona teammates Lionel Messi and Neymar Jr, who were recently booed by the PSG fans following the French club's Champions League exit. Taking to Instagram Stories, Suarez posted a picture with Messi and Neymar and wrote, "As always, football has no memories. Always with you. I love you very much."

169.title: Common man can flourish: Sanitation worker who won on BJP ticket in UP
169.article_body: Ganesh Chandra Chauhan, a sanitation worker who contested on BJP's ticket in UP Assembly elections from Dhanghata constituency, said that his win has proved that a common man can also flourish. Chauhan said that the state has reformed under BJP's governance, adding that UP residents have "rejected dynasty politics and casteism". Chauhan defeated SBSP's Alagu Prasad by 10,553 votes.

170.title: Do you agree to this fight?: Musk to Putin after challenging him to single combat
170.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday in a tweet tagged the President of Russia's official Twitter account and asked, "Do you agree to this fight?" In an earlier tweet, Musk had said, "I hereby challenge Vladimir Putin to single combat...Stakes are Ukraine." When a Twitter user asked, "Did you think this through?", Musk responded, "I am absolutely serious."

171.title: 32-yr-old man sexually assaults 4-yr-old girl in Pune, arrested
171.article_body: A 32-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a four-year-old girl in the Khed area in Maharashtra's Pune district. The accused allegedly asked the girl to accompany him to his room and assaulted her on Friday and Saturday, police said. The matter was reported to the police by the girl's mother.

172.title: Govt hasn't agreed to set up regulator for crypto investments: MoS Finance
172.article_body: The government has not agreed to set up a regulatory authority for investments in cryptocurrencies, the Minister of State for Finance, Pankaj Chaudhary, informed the Lok Sabha on Monday. On being asked about policies regarding misleading crypto ads, he replied that the government and the RBI have been cautioning investors about potential economic, financial, legal, and security related risks.

173.title: Have no server outside India: CEO denies report of Paytm Payments Bank data leak
173.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma dismissed a report that claimed RBI barred Paytm Payments Bank from onboarding new customers over data leak to Chinese entities.
