He said, "Absolutely false...The RBI in its letter didn't raise concern over any leak of data...We have no server that is outside India, and no foreign national has any access to our servers."

174.title: China slams 4 firms for falsifying carbon data, forging test reports
174.article_body: China's Ministry of Ecology and Environment (MEE) charged four data verification firms with tampering and forging test reports, making false coal samples and writing distorted, inaccurate conclusions. The move is a part of a campaign by MEE that aims to determine the accuracy of carbon emission verification reports submitted across China. The campaign was launched in October-December last year.

175.title: LIC IPO likely to be launched in mid-May: Reports
175.article_body: LIC's IPO may be postponed to mid-May amid rising market volatility due to the Russia-Ukraine war, Moneycontrol reported. India NSE Volatility Index was at about 26 in Mumbai on Monday, 11 points above the required 15 to launch the IPO. If the IPO is not launched before May 12, a new IPO prospectus will have to be filed by LIC.

176.title: Shraddha becomes second most-followed Indian actress on Instagram
176.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor has become the second-most followed Indian actress on Instagram with over 70 million followers. She is preceded by actress Priyanka Chopra who has 75.1 million followers on the social media platform. Shraddha made her Bollywood debut in 2010 film 'Teen Patti'. She will next be seen in Luv Ranjan's untitled romantic-comedy film along with actor Ranbir Kapoor.

177.title: 3,000 kg smuggled gold seized by Delhi Customs in last 11 years
177.article_body: Delhi's customs department has seized nearly 3,000 kg gold worth around ₹1,535 crore in 2,522 cases of smuggling in the last 11 years, according to an RTI reply. As many as 1,632 people, including 324 foreigners, were arrested in these cases. The highest amount of gold was seized in 2014-15 at 574 kg, followed by 505 kg seized in 2015-16.

178.title: I-T dept conducts searches at real estate group Omaxe's premises
178.article_body: The Income Tax Department on Monday conducted searches at premises of real estate group Omaxe. At least 30 locations in Delhi-NCR and few others in Uttar Pradesh and Punjab are being searched on charges of tax evasion, officials said. Searches conducted by the department are linked to alleged irregularities and concealment of income by the company.

179.title: B'luru man returning home with food for mother rides into pothole, dies
179.article_body: A 27-year-old man died on Monday after his bike hit a pothole and he fell on the road in Bengaluru. The incident took place when he was returning home after getting food packed for his mother from a hotel on Sunday late night. The victim worked at a private firm and he was the only earning member in his family.

180.title: Rachakonda Police bust ₹10-crore railway job scam, 2 arrested
180.article_body: Rachakonda Police have busted a railway job scam, which allegedly defrauded more than 100 job aspirants of over ₹10 crore and also arrested two accused, it said on Monday. The accused had allegedly assured aspirants of jobs in the railways without having to appear for examinations. Police also seized ₹9 lakh cash, two cars and fraudulent documents from the accused.

181.title: Retail inflation rises to 8-month-high of 6.07% in February 2022
181.article_body: India's retail inflation rose to an eight-month-high of 6.07% in February 2022, government data showed on Monday. This is the second successive month that retail inflation has breached the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) upper margin of 6%. The retail inflation, measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), stood at 6.01% for the month of January in 2022.

182.title: Ganga river water is fit for bathing: Centre
182.article_body: The dissolved oxygen level of river Ganga is within acceptable limits of the bathing criteria, the Centre said on Monday. The dissolved oxygen level is a measure to assess the health of the water body. None of the Ganga stretches is in priority category I-IV (most polluted categories) while two stretches are in category V (least polluted category).

183.title: Iranian Foreign Minister to visit Russia on March 15: Govt
183.article_body: Spokesperson for Iranian Foreign Ministry on Monday said Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian is slated to visit Russia on Tuesday, March 15. The minister will visit the country as nuclear talks between Iran, Western powers face the prospect of collapse. This comes after Russia demanded guarantees that Iran-Russia trade would not be affected by   sanctions on Moscow over Ukrainian invasion.

184.title: India win record-extending 15th straight Test series at home, whitewash Sri Lanka 2-0
184.article_body: India defeated Sri Lanka by 238 runs in three days in the Day-Night Test in Bengaluru to complete a 2-0 series whitewash. India have now extended their record for winning most consecutive Test series at home with 15 straight series victories. Notably, India have lost just one of their last 30 Test series on home soil.

185.title: Russia offering oil at heavy discount, India looking to buy it: Report
185.article_body: India is considering taking up a Russian offer to buy its crude oil and other commodities at discounted prices, Reuters reported. India, which imports 80% of its oil needs, usually buys about 2% to 3% of its supplies from Russia. "Russia is offering oil and other commodities at a heavy discount. We'll be happy to take that," an official said.

186.title: I hereby challenge Putin to single combat, stakes are Ukraine: Elon Musk
186.article_body:
World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "I hereby challenge Vladimir Putin
to single combat...Stakes are Ukraine." When a Twitter user asked, "Will you be surprised when he (Russian President Putin) accepts your challenge?", Musk responded, "That would be an honour." Musk's tweet garnered users' reactions like, "Go to bed Elon," and "I need some of what you're drinking."

187.title: Employees of Pune's Hinjewadi IT park being asked to return to offices
187.article_body: Over two lakh IT companies' employees in Pune's Hinjewadi software park, who have been working from home for last two years, are gradually being asked to return to offices as COVID-19 cases decline. Pavanjit Mane of Forum of IT Employees said some companies have circulated forms asking employees' views. Earlier, the companies conducted special camps to get their employees vaccinated.

188.title: Man beats wife, tries to kill brother for protecting her in Gurugram
188.article_body: Police have booked a man for allegedly trying to kill his brother twice on Saturday after he saved his sister-in-law from getting assaulted by him in Gurugram, officials said on Sunday. Police said that the accused allegedly stabbed his brother with a knife on Saturday and escaped. However, he returned later with a pistol and opened fire at his brother.

189.title: Tata Sons chief N Chandrasekaran appointed as Air India chairman
189.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran was appointed as the chairman of Air India on Monday. His appointment comes a month after he was given a five-year extension in his term as Tata Sons’ Executive Chairman. Meanwhile, Air India is currently looking for a new CEO after the former Chairman of Turkish Airlines Ilker Ayci declined to be Air India's CEO.

190.title: 14 trapped for 90 minutes as lift stucks at Chennai railway station
190.article_body: As many as 14 people, including a toddler, were trapped inside an elevator at the Nungambakkam railway station in Chennai after it stuck for around 90 minutes on Sunday night. Officials removed the fan inside the elevator and lifted up the people through a hole. An official said overloading may have caused the elevator to malfunction.

191.title: Mumbai Police band plays 'Srivalli' song from 'Pushpa: The Rise'
191.article_body: The Mumbai Police's band, Khaki Studio, on Monday released their rendition of the song 'Srivalli' from the movie 'Pushpa: The Rise'. Sharing the video, the force tweeted, "#KhakiStudio rukhega nahi! We noticed Mumbaikars swaying to the tunes of 'Srivalli' and decided to join in!". The band had previously played songs like the James Bond theme and Bella Ciao.

192.title: SP won 304 seats in ballot paper counting: SP Maurya alleges foul play
192.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader SP Maurya on Monday said his party "won on 304 seats in the ballot paper counting while BJP won on just 99 seats". He alleged that when counting was done from EVM, BJP won. "This means there is some foul play," he said. Former UP minister Maurya joined SP on January 14 after leaving BJP.

193.title: He always wants to get better than yesterday: Gavaskar on Bumrah
193.article_body: Calling Jasprit Bumrah a "successful bowler" following his eighth five-wicket Test haul in Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said the India pacer always wants to get better than yesterday. "The skillset and variety he has no batsman can feel at ease. He has got this ability to get...batsman out when the batter is set," he stated.

194.title: Kiran gave list of my weaknesses, drawbacks: Aamir on best b'day gift
194.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan has revealed that the best birthday gift of his life was the list of his weaknesses and drawbacks made by his ex-wife Kiran Rao. "She gave me a list of 10 to 12 points that I sat and wrote as well," the actor added. Aamir further said that she pointed it all out with honesty and love.

195.title: COVID-19 positivity rate dips to 3.3% in Pune, nobody on ventilator
195.article_body: The daily COVID-19 positivity rate in Pune has dropped to 3.34% and the city currently has no patient on ventilator support, while only one patient is on oxygen support in a hospital, health officials said. "Only 14 of the 574 active COVID-19 patients are currently in hospital, which is just 2.43%," said a civic health officer.

196.title: Prabhas' 'Radhe Shyam' earns ₹151 crore worldwide in 3 days
196.article_body: Prabhas and Pooja Hegde-starrer 'Radhe Shyam' has grossed ₹151 crore at the worldwide box office within three days of its release. UV Creations, the production house behind the period romantic drama, shared the news on Monday, writing on Twitter, "A phenomenal response for #RadheShyam with ₹151 crore gross in three days worldwide. #BlockBusterRadheShyam."

197.title: Misplaced pass, 'savage' Go First employee said 'Catch next flight': Babil
197.article_body: Actor Babil took to Instagram Stories to share that he was told to "go catch the next flight" by a Go First, formerly known as GoAir, employee after the actor told him that he had misplaced his boarding pass. "I know GoAir has rude staff reputation but...that is not rude that is savage," Babil wrote.

198.title: 3.5 million children in Afghanistan need nutritious treatment: WFP
198.article_body: United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) has said that 3.5 million children in Afghanistan currently need nutritious treatment. UNICEF had earlier said that half of the Afghan children aged below five will be exposed to acute malnutrition in 2022. Afghanistan has been experiencing food shortages amid an economic crisis triggered after the Taliban seized power in the country last year.

199.title: Ravichandran Ashwin becomes 8th highest wicket-taker in Test cricket history
199.article_body: Team India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has become the eighth-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket history. After dismissing Dhananjaya de Silva in Sri Lanka's second innings in the Day-Night Test, Ashwin took his tally of Test wickets to 440, overtaking Dale Steyn's tally of 439 wickets. Ex-West Indies pacer Courtney Walsh is the seventh-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket with 519 scalps.

200.title: What is the Mumbai Climate Action Plan all about?
200.article_body: The Mumbai Climate Action Plan announced by the Maharashtra government on Sunday aims towards zero emission of greenhouse gas or a net-zero target for 2050. Mumbai's target puts it two decades ahead of India's national goal of cutting its emissions to net-zero by 2070. It proposes large-scale changes on priority across six strategic areas.

201.title: Hindi remake of Tamil action thriller 'Aaranya Kaandam' in the works
201.article_body: Producers Ramesh Taurani and Akshai Puri have acquired rights to the Tamil neo-noir action thriller 'Aaranya Kaandam'. It will be directed by Ajay Bahl, who has helmed films like 'Section 375' and 'B.A. Pass'. The film follows a day in the lives of six characters, played by Jackie Shroff, Ravi Krishna, Sampath Raj, Yasmin Ponnappa, Guru Somasundaram and Master Vasanth.

202.title: Fifty vs Pak was easy, but century vs WI came at risky situation: Mandhana
202.article_body: Talking about her performance in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup, India Women opener Smriti Mandhana said her century against WI is a special one as it came when team was in a "risky situation". "The first one [52-run knock against Pakistan] was achieved in easy circumstances," she added. In India's three matches, Mandhana has scored 52, 6, 123 runs.

203.title: Make 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free in Rajasthan: Cong MLA
203.article_body: Rajasthan Congress MLA Bhanwar Lal Sharma has urged the Congress-led state government to make 'The Kashmir Files' a tax-free movie in the state. Sharma added that he "will write a letter to CM Ashok Gehlot" for the same. The movie has already been made tax-free by the governments of Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh and Haryana.

204.title: Putin is frustrated with progress of Russian forces in Ukraine: US
204.article_body: US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin is frustrated that his forces are not making the kind of progress that he thought they would make in Ukraine, including in Kyiv. Sullivan added that for this reason, Putin is expanding the number of targets and trying to cause damage in every part of the country.

205.title: PM greeted with 'Modi, Modi' chants in Parliament after state poll wins
205.article_body: PM Narendra Modi was greeted by 'Modi, Modi' chants as he entered the Parliament to attend the second half of the Budget session as it resumed today. BJP MPs and Union Ministers were seen chanting PM's name and thumping the desks as the latter took his seat in the Lok Sabha. BJP emerged victorious in UP, Uttarakhand, Manipur and Goa.

206.title: Completely false: Paytm Payments Bank on report of leaking data to Chinese firms
206.article_body: Paytm Payments Bank denied a report that claimed that it was punished by the RBI for allegedly sharing information with China-based entities that indirectly own a stake in Paytm Payments Bank. "The report is completely false and simply sensationalising," the company said. Notably, China's Alibaba Group Holding and its affiliate, Jack Ma's Ant Group, own shares of Paytm.

207.title: Medical supplies continue to reach war-torn Ukraine: WHO
207.article_body: The WHO has said that the medical supplies including trauma kits, oxygen generators and drugs continue to reach Ukraine, which is under attack by Russian forces. "The coming days and weeks will see a constant flow of medical supplies," it said. It admitted that supply chains have been disrupted and that hospitals are struggling to cater to the patients.

208.title: His frustration is being seen on ground: Irfan on lack of runs from Kohli
208.article_body: Irfan Pathan has said Virat Kohli's frustration due to lack of runs from him is being seen on the ground. "Mistakes we are seeing from Kohli, we didn't use to see them earlier," he added. Following Kohli's 23 and 13 in ongoing second Test against Sri Lanka, his average slipped below fifty in Test cricket for first time since 2017.

209.title: Portion of balcony collapses in Delhi's Anand Parbat area, 4 injured
209.article_body: As many as four people were injured after a portion of their balcony collapsed in Delhi. The incident took place in the Anand Parbat area of the national capital on Sunday night. Reports said that officials of the Delhi Fire Service rushed to the spot and gave details about the incident.

210.title: My Ferrari can't go through: UK singer as he fills potholes near his house
210.article_body: Britain's 77-year-old singer Rod Stewart filled potholes on a road near his house in Harlow, Essex. In an Instagram video that showed him filling potholes, Stewart said, "People are bashing their cars up. The other day, there was an ambulance with a burst tyre. My Ferrari can't go through here at all." He added, "It's been like this for ages."

211.title: Indian Army constructs 2 houses within 4 weeks using 3D printing technology in Guj
211.article_body: The Indian Army's Military Engineering Services has constructed two houses in South Western Air Command in Gujarat's Gandhinagar within four weeks using 3D rapid construction technology, an official release said. Officials claim the houses are first-of-its-kind structures in India. Each house has a built area of around 700 square feet and is in compliance with Zone-3 earthquake specifications.

212.title: Andrea Bocelli's son to team up with Sukriti & Prakriti for a song: Report
212.article_body: Italian opera singer Andrea Bocelli's son Matteo is set to collaborate with singers, Prakriti Kakar and Sukriti Kakar, for a song, according to a report. "The single will be a classic east meets west collaborative effort and will embrace a lot of futuristic and experimental fusion soundscapes," a source told Pinkvilla. Matteo is expected to arrive in India this month.

213.title: Big B ensured we rehearsed thrice even for 1-2 lines: Maha official on 'Jhund'
213.article_body: Maharashtra state surveillance officer Dr Pradeep Awate, who shared screen space with actor Amitabh Bachchan in 'Jhund' said that Amitabh would ensure that rehearsals for a scene happened at least thrice even if it was one or two lines. "Despite his stature and experience as an actor, Amitabhji took the effort to ensure a perfect shot," Dr Awate said.

214.title: I am pretty surprised to see where he was standing: Karthik on Kohli's dismissal
214.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli getting LBW out for 13 runs in the second innings of the Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka, Dinesh Karthik said, "I am pretty surprised to see where he was standing in the crease." Karthik added, "He was standing much outside leg stump." Karthik further suggested that Kohli should have been standing on middle and leg stump.

215.title: Bengaluru man sues restaurant for 40 paise overcharge, fined ₹4,000
215.article_body: A consumer court ordered a Bengaluru senior citizen to pay ₹4,000 in compensation to a restaurant, Hotel Empire, after the former filed a lawsuit alleging that the restaurant had overcharged him by 40 paise. The judges ordered the petitioner, Murthy, to pay the compensation to the restaurant and stated that Murthy was "wasting the court's time for publicity".

216.title: Billionaire Founder of S Korean internet firm Kakao quits board
216.article_body: Brian Kim, the billionaire Founder of South Korea's leading chat app operator Kakao, has stepped down from the company's board. The development comes after reports claimed police were probing allegations that Kim evaded nearly $740 million taxes in 2014. Recently, the company was also criticised over sale of stock by top executives after a Kakao unit's successful stock market debut.

217.title: Nadal favourite to potentially win the Roland Garros 2022: Murray
217.article_body: British tennis player Andy Murray said that Rafael Nadal is the favourite to potentially win the Roland Garros 2022. Murray added Nadal has less pressure than the last couple of French Opens due to his good start to the year. In the ongoing season, Nadal has won three titles, including the Australian Open 2022, and is 16-0.

218.title: CBSE forms panel after complaints of wrong answer key in Class 10 Odia exam
218.article_body: CBSE has decided to constitute an expert committee after it received complaints from a school that the answer key of the Odia Language paper in the Term-1 Class 10 board exams was fractionally "wrong". CBSE further said, "An appropriate decision will be taken by the Board within 24 hours, on the basis of the report of the expert committee."

219.title: Pant is best wicketkeeper in terms of having impact on game: Parthiv
219.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said Rishabh Pant has consistently improved his wicketkeeping. He added Pant is among the top three Indian wicketkeepers in terms of batting ability. "If it's about having...impact on...game, then Pant is currently the best wicketkeeper," Parthiv stated. Pant scored the fastest fifty by an Indian in Test cricket in the Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka.

220.title: SP ally RLD dissolves all its units, frontals in Uttar Pradesh
220.article_body: Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) announced to "dissolve" its units (state, regional and district) and frontals in Uttar Pradesh "with immediate effect" on Monday. The party said that the directions for this order have been given by its national president Jayant Chaudhary. RLD contested the recent UP state Assembly elections in an alliance with the Akhilesh Yadav-led Samajwadi Party.

221.title: Chennai Metro opens 2 new stations in phase-1 extension stretch
221.article_body: Chennai Metro Rail Limited (CMRL) opened the Tiruvottiyur Theradi and Wimco Nagar Depot stations in phase-1 extension between Washermanpet and Wimco Nagar on Sunday. Commuters will also be able to park their vehicles at Wimco Nagar metro station free of charge till March 31, CMRL said. Phase-1 metro line consists of two corridors, Washermanpet-Chennai Airport and Chennai Central-St Thomas Mount.

222.title: Was ragged in school, was told 'Your dad wears sunglasses at night': Bappi's son
222.article_body: Late musician Bappi Lahiri's son Bappa Lahiri in an interview revealed that he used to get ragged in school because of his father's sunglasses. "People said, 'Oh, your father wears sunglasses at night, he can't see etc'," he added. "Today it's become like a trend. He never went by the book when it came to style," Bappa further said.

223.title: Meta prohibits calls for death of a head of state amid Russia-Ukraine war
223.article_body: Meta clarified on Sunday that it's not allowing posts calling for the death of a head of state in context of Russian invasion of Ukraine, Reuters reported citing President of Global Affairs Nick Clegg. This comes after Meta allowed some posts seeking the death of Russian President Vladimir Putin. "We are not condoning violence against Russians in general," Clegg wrote.

224.title: Clash between SP and BJP supporters leads to stone-pelting in UP; 10 booked
224.article_body: A political argument between supporters of Samajwadi Party and BJP led to a clash and stone-pelting in Uttar Pradesh, police said. According to police, an FIR was registered against 10 persons and three of them were detained in this connection. "Four police teams were rushed to the spot to contain the situation. Those involved...managed to escape," a police officer said.

225.title: Take responsibility for Uttarakhand defeat, apologised to members: Harish
225.article_body: Congress leader and former Uttarakhand Chief Minister Harish Rawat said that he takes responsibility for Congress' defeat in the Uttarakhand Assembly elections. "All of us thought that we were winning in Uttarakhand...I apologised to every member and leadership in the working committee. I have also apologised to the public before," Rawat said.

226.title: British Academy Film Awards pay tribute to Lata Mangeshkar in 'In Memoriam'
226.article_body: The late singer Lata Mangeshkar was featured in the 'In Memoriam' segment at the 2022 edition of the British Academy of Film and Television Awards. The tribute described her as "an Indian playback singer, who recorded an estimated 25,000 songs for more than 1,000 Hindi films over a career spanning 70 years". She passed away aged 92 on February 6.

227.title: Cong leaders don't have courage to make party Gandhi-mukt: BJP MP
227.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Modi has taken a dig at the Congress by saying that "Congress leaders don't have the courage to make their party Gandhi-mukt". "Drowned in corruption and dynastic politics, Congress has been pretending to brainstorm for the past many years," Modi said in a reference to Congress' defeat in the recent five state Assembly elections.

228.title: Sensex ends 935 points higher at 56,486, Nifty settles at 16,871
228.article_body: The Sensex on Monday climbed 935 points or 1.68% to settle at 56,486, while Nifty 50 jumped 241 points or 1.45% higher to close at 16,871. While Infosys was the top Nifty gainer as it rose close to 4%, Paytm shares fell more than 12% to hit an all-time low of ₹672 on the BSE on Monday.

229.title: Not a VIP, won't be given special facilities in jail: Court denies home food for Chitra
229.article_body: A Delhi court remarked that former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna is "not a VIP" and won't be provided special facilities during her 14-day judicial custody. Denying her home-cooked food, it said, "There are inmates who are in their 70s, who eat Tihar jail food. I have myself eaten Tihar...food. It’s good...VIP prisoners want everything...Every accused, every prisoner is the same."

230.title: 2 dead after shell hits residential building in Ukraine: Official
230.article_body: At least two people have died and three were hospitalised after a shell hit a nine-storey residential building in Ukraine's Kyiv on Monday, Internal Affairs adviser Anton Gerashchenko said. The fire was extinguished at 7.58 am, emergency services said. This comes as Ukraine's Deputy PM announced that they'll try to evacuate trapped civilians through 10 humanitarian corridors the same day.

231.title: Excited to get started with MI, looks very close-knit team: Archer
231.article_body: England pacer Jofra Archer, who was bought by MI for ₹8 crore in the IPL mega auction, has said he's really excited to get started with the franchise. "MI looks very close-knit and family-oriented and such teams always do well," he stated. Archer is likely to miss the upcoming season and feature for the franchise in IPL 2023.

232.title: 15-year-old girl gang-raped near Ahmedabad, 8 men arrested
232.article_body: Eight men were arrested on Sunday for allegedly abducting and raping a 15-year-old girl on the outskirts of Ahmedabad. According to police, the girl was brought to a secluded area by the main accused, where he had also called seven of his friends. She was then taken near a boring well where the eight men forced themselves upon her.

233.title: NASA shares pic of infant star's energetic outburst, says 'A star is born'
233.article_body: NASA has shared the picture of an energetic outburst from an infant star captured by the Hubble Space Telescope. Sharing the picture on Twitter, NASA tweeted, "A star is born." NASA explained, "This stellar tantrum, produced by an extremely young star in the earliest phase of formation, consists of an incandescent jet of gas travelling at supersonic speeds."

234.title: Singer Kanika Kapoor to get married second time in May: Report
234.article_body: Singer Kanika Kapoor, known for her song 'Baby Doll', will be getting married to NRI businessman Gautam in May, reported ETimes. This will be the singer's second marriage. She was earlier married to NRI businessman Raj Chandok and got divorced in 2012. Kanika and Gautam have reportedly been dating for a year and their wedding will take place in London.

235.title: No COVID-19 death reported in Navi Mumbai in March so far
235.article_body: No COVID-19 death was reported in the Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) in March so far. The civic body saw death due to COVID-19 last time on February 26. The city has so far reported 2,049 COVID-19 deaths, of which around 75 deaths were reported during the third wave of the pandemic.

236.title: Pant and Dhoni will stand out as India's greatest wicketkeepers: Karthik
236.article_body: Dinesh Karthik has said Rishabh Pant is on his way to greatness after the India wicketkeeper-batter  broke Kapil Dev's 40-year-old record (30-ball 50) to become the fastest half-centurion (28-ball 50) for India in Tests. He added that if Pant has a full-fledged wicketkeeping career then he and Dhoni will stand out as India's greatest wicketkeepers to have played the game.

237.title: AAP has enough experience to run Punjab govt: Bhagwant Mann
237.article_body: Punjab CM-designate Bhagwant Mann on Monday said AAP has enough experience to run the Punjab government. "We know how to run the administration. I have been a member of [Lok Sabha] for seven years," Mann said. He added, "Many veteran politicians have lost the elections and new people have won...There'll be out of the box thinking in this government."

238.title: KTR inaugurates data sciences company Gramener's new office in Hyd
238.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday inaugurated the new office of data sciences company Gramener in Hyderabad. The New Jersey-based company's Hyderabad office will have the capacity to aid enterprises with over 250 data science resources, the Telangana government has said. "Data sciences...is hugely underrated [right now] in a country like India," KTR said at the ceremony.

239.title: India improves in Maternal Mortality Ratio, on track to achieve 2030 goal: Govt
239.article_body: India made a significant improvement in Maternal Mortality Ratio as the number of deaths per lakh childbirths declined from 113 in 2016-18 to 103 in 2017-19, said the government. The country is on track to achieve the National Health Policy (NHP) target of 100/lakh live births by 2020 and the SDG target of 70/lakh live births by 2030, it added.

240.title: BJP lied about support to displaced Kashmiri Pandit families: Kerala Cong
240.article_body: Kerala Congress said BJP lied about government support to displaced [Kashmiri] Pandit families & claimed credit for Congress government's initiatives. "UPA government gave jobs to 15,000 Pandits, recruited 6,000 Pandits in J&K government," party's tweet read. "Pandits' migration started...in January 1990. BJP did nothing and continued supporting VP Singh till November 1990," another tweet said.

241.title: Actress Rebel Wilson flashes middle finger at Putin during BAFTA Awards
241.article_body: Australian actress Rebel Wilson flashed her middle finger at Russian President Vladimir Putin amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine while hosting the BAFTA Film Awards 2022. "This is the gesture for Putin," the 42-year-old actress said, flipping her middle finger as she spoke. BAFTA's Twitter handle shared her video and tweeted, "Here's a lesson in sign language from Rebel Wilson."

242.title: Gang of robbers arrested after gunfight in Delhi's Seemapuri
242.article_body: A gang of robbers was arrested by Delhi Police on Saturday following a gunfight in Delhi's Seemapuri area. Police confiscated two stolen bicycles, one pistol, three revolvers, 37 live ammunition, pepper spray and hammers from the gang. Two of the four accused were shot after police received a tip-off and laid a trap to nab them.

243.title: Vicky wins Performance of Year, Akshay wins Person of Year at Hello Hall of Fame Awards
243.article_body: Vicky Kaushal was awarded for Performance of the Year and Akshay Kumar was named Person of the Year at the HELLO! Hall Of Fame Awards 2022. Kiara Advani won the Best Actor Critic's Choice award. Kartik Aaryan and Kriti Sanon won for Best Actor Popular Choice male and female respectively. Veteran actress Rekha was honoured with the Cinematic Legend award.

244.title: B'luru city bus pass to be available online, can be booked via app
244.article_body: The passes for the Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) will be available online and can be booked via the mobile application Tummoc. All electronic payments, including QR codes, will be accepted for the purchase of passes. At present, passengers have to visit Traffic Transit Management Centres (TTMCs) and bus stations to obtain the passes.

245.title: Aus, Netherlands start legal action against Russia over MH17 downing
245.article_body: Australia and Netherlands said that they've started legal action against Russia at International Civil Aviation Organization over downing of Malaysian Airlines flight MH17 in July 2014. "Death of 298 civilians...can't...remain without consequences," Dutch Minister Wopke Hoekstra said. The Kuala Lumpur-bound plane was hit over rebel-held eastern Ukraine by what was deemed to be a Russian missile.

246.title: Police personnel in Madhya Pradesh to get leave to watch 'The Kashmir Files'
246.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Monday said he has informed the DGP to grant leave for one day to all police personnel in the state to watch Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files', whenever they choose to do so with their families. This comes after CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday declared 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free in the state.

247.title: 10 humanitarian corridors to operate today: Ukraine Deputy PM
247.article_body: Ukraine's Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk has said that the country will try to evacuate trapped civilians through 10 humanitarian corridors that have been agreed upon for today. She added that civilians in towns near Kyiv and in eastern Luhansk will be able to use them. Earlier, Ukraine President said that 1.25 lakh people have been evacuated via humanitarian corridors.

248.title: Ukraine finish second behind China in 2022 Winter Paralympic medal count
248.article_body: Ukraine finished second in the 2022 Winter Paralympics in Beijing. Ukraine won 11 gold medals, 10 silver medals and eight bronze medals. China finished first with 18 gold medals and a total of 61 medals. Ukrainian athletes were the last delegation to arrive in Beijing because of logistical challenges caused by Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

249.title: Rishabh Pant has backed his strengths, he's learning: Jasprit Bumrah
249.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah said the team will help Rishabh Pant go forward with the tempo he likes to play at. "You can't teach everyone to play in the same manner. Pant has backed his strengths...he's [also] learning a lot and getting experience," he added. Pant smashed the fastest Test fifty by an Indian in the ongoing Sri Lanka Test.

250.title: India's wholesale inflation rises to 13.11% in February 2022
250.article_body: Wholesale inflation in India rose 828 basis points YoY from 4.83% in February 2021 to 13.11% in February 2022, as per Commerce Ministry's data. Wholesale inflation was at 12.96% in January 2022. The Ministry said high inflation in February was caused by rising prices of mineral oils, metals, crude petroleum, natural gas and food articles, among other commodities.

251.title: 'I'm done being quiet, grow the f*** up,' says Pete to Kanye; pics of chat surface
251.article_body: Screenshots of a text exchange between Kanye and Pete Davidson have surfaced in which Pete purportedly said, "I'm done being quiet. Grow the f*** up." Pete also said, "Kim (Kardashian) is the best mother I've ever met...You're so f****** lucky that she's your kids' mom." This came after Kanye claimed that his children weren't allowed to go to Sunday service.

252.title: 4 booked for entering B'luru stadium to take selfie with Virat Kohli
252.article_body: Four people, including two minors, have been booked for criminal trespassing after they ran onto the Bengaluru cricket stadium and tried taking a selfie with Virat Kohli on Sunday. They had trespassed into the playing area during a break at a match between India and Sri Lanka. The players continue to be in a bio bubble due to COVID-19 restrictions.

253.title: Virat said 'It's okay, you can fail': Harshal on 37-run joint-worst over in IPL history
253.article_body: Recalling his 37-run over against CSK last season, which is also the joint-worst over in IPL's history, RCB pacer Harshal Patel said, "Virat came up to me and said, 'You got hit...it happens. [When] you put yourself in difficult situations, you can [sometimes] fail'." Harshal added that Virat understands the "pressure situations" and has been very supportive of him.

254.title: Germany to buy F-35 fighter jets capable of carrying nuclear bombs: Report
254.article_body: Germany is planning to purchase F-35 fighter jets to replace its Tornado aircraft, according to a Reuters report quoting government sources. The country is reportedly looking to buy up to 35 stealth jets. Manufactured by US firm Lockheed Martin, the jets are capable of carrying nuclear bombs. Notably, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz recently announced an increase in defence spending.

255.title: Ex-NSE CEO Ramkrishna sent to 14-day judicial custody in co-location scam
255.article_body: A Delhi court on Monday sent former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna to 14-day judicial custody in the co-location case. Ramkrishna, who has been accused of sharing confidential information with a 'Himalayan yogi', was arrested by the CBI a few days back. Earlier, CBI had demanded 14-day custody of Ramkrishna saying that she had been "evasive in her replies".

256.title: Will Smith, Jessica Chastain win best actor awards at Critics Choice Awards
256.article_body: Actor Will Smith won the Best Actor award and Jessica Chastain bagged the Best Actress award at the 2022 Critics Choice Awards on Sunday. While Smith won the award for the film 'King Richard', Chastain was awarded for her performance in 'The Eyes of Tammy Faye'. The award for Best Picture went to 'The Power of the Dog'.

257.title: Won't comment, don't want to become gossip: Jubin on dating Nikita
257.article_body: Singer Jubin Nautiyal, on being asked if he is dating actress Nikita Dutta, said that he won't like to comment as they don't want to become the subject of gossip. The two sparked dating rumours after being spotted together in Mumbai's Juhu. "Nikita and I were just hanging out at a cafe in Juhu for some time," Jubin added.

258.title: Tara to star in 'Kabir Singh' producer Murad's thriller 'Apurva': Reports
258.article_body: Actress Tara Sutaria has signed on to star in 'Kabir Singh' producer Murad Khetani's women-centric film titled 'Apurva', as per reports. The upcoming thriller is expected to be a small-budget project. 'Apurva' will reportedly be directed by Nikhil Bhat, who helmed the show 'The Gone Game'. Tara will also be seen sharing screen space with Tiger Shroff in 'Heropanti 2'.

259.title: Vanced app, which blocks YouTube ads, to shut down over 'legal reasons'
259.article_body: YouTube Vanced app, which lets users block ads on YouTube without Premium subscription, is shutting down "due to legal reasons". According to The Verge, Google had sent the Vanced owners a cease and desist letter recently. "We were asked to remove all references to 'YouTube', change the logo, and remove links related to YouTube," the Vanced team told The Verge.

260.title: Don't be afraid: Sea's secretive billionaire CEO to staff on tech firm losing $150 bn value
260.article_body: Forrest Li, the 44-year-old secretive billionaire CEO of Singapore-based technology firm Sea Ltd, which owns e-commerce platform Shopee, mobile game Garena Free Fire among other businesses, wrote a 900-word memo to his employees. The memo addressed a $150-billion plunge in his company's value since late 2021. He wrote, "This drop is painful...Do not fear: We're in a strong position internally."

261.title: I'm here for all witches: Emma seemingly criticises JK Rowling at BAFTA
261.article_body: Actress Emma Watson, who presented an award at the BAFTA Awards 2022, was introduced as a witch for her Harry Potter character Hermione Granger. Emma came to the podium and stated, "I am here for all of the witches." A social media user commented, "Sly lil dig at JK Rowling there, Emma Watson?" while another wrote, "What a QUEEEEENNN."

262.title: Kashmiri Pandits' plight an outcome of Nehruvian blunders: Union Minister
262.article_body: Days after release of 'The Kashmir Files' movie, Union Minister Jitendra Singh blamed the Congress party for the plight of Kashmiri Pandits who were forced to leave the valley. "History [is] witness to the fact that all this was a cumulative outcome of a series of Congress blunders beginning from what's now recorded as infamous Nehruvian blunders," said Singh.

263.title: Snares to catch peacocks found on hills near Pune village
263.article_body: Forest department officials are monitoring the situation after people found snares to catch peacocks on hills near a village in Pune's Hinjewadi. Hunting and killing of peacocks, which is India's National Bird, is prohibited by law and carries a sentence of up to seven years in jail, an activist said. Residents have been warned about the traps, the activist added.

264.title: Delhi fountain partially closed, PWD says 'tipplers wanted to take shower'
264.article_body: The public works department in Delhi has partially closed the fountains on the stretch along the Old BRT corridor from Chirag Dilli FOB to Sheikh Sarai corridor. "Tipplers used to come during night...take selfies, sing songs and dance along the stretch...they wanted to take a shower...or wash their faces in it...they even misbehaved with security guard," a PWD official said.

265.title: iPhone supplier Foxconn halts production in China's Shenzhen amid COVID-19 curbs
265.article_body: Apple iPhone supplier Foxconn on Monday said that it has suspended operations until further notice in China's Shenzhen city after authorities imposed lockdown measures in the tech hub city amid rising COVID-19 cases. Foxconn added it would deploy backup plants to reduce the disruption to production. On Sunday, China reported over 3,000 new daily cases, its highest in two years.

266.title: Son Junaid was rejected for Mira Nair's 'A Suitable Boy': Aamir
266.article_body: Aamir Khan has revealed that his son, Junaid Khan, went for a screen test for Mira Nair's 'A Suitable Boy' but was not selected. "He never mentioned to anyone that he was my son...He made his own journey. He learnt theatre, he did plays, he got rejected from 15-20 places," Aamir added. Junaid will make his debut with YRF's 'Maharaja'.

267.title: Class 12 Chemistry paper wasn't leaked, false propaganda being spread: Maha minister
267.article_body: Maharashtra School Education Minister Varsha Eknath Gaikwad has clarified that the Class 12 Chemistry paper of state board was not leaked. Gaikwad added that "false propaganda" is being spread through social media. This comes after reports claimed the paper was leaked hours ahead of the exam. Earlier on Monday, a coaching centre's owner was arrested in Mumbai in this connection.

268.title: SA record their highest successful chase in Women's WC history, win 3 matches in a row
268.article_body: South Africa chased down a target of 236 against defending champions England to register their highest successful chase in Women's World Cup history. South Africa's previous highest successful chase in Women's World Cup had come in 2017, when they chased down a target of 207 against Pakistan. South Africa have now won three straight matches in 2022 Women's World Cup.

269.title: COVID vaccine for 12-14 age group, booster dose for everyone above 60 from Mar 16: Govt
269.article_body: Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya today announced COVID-19 vaccination of children in age group of 12 to 14 will begin from March 16. He further said that everyone aged 60-plus will now be able to get precaution doses. He wrote, "I urge the families of children and people in the age group of 60-plus that they must get the vaccine."

270.title: Tharoor shares selfie with AAP's Mann, calls it 'parliamentary camaraderie'
270.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Monday posted a selfie with Punjab CM-designate Bhagwant Mann. Sharing the picture, Tharoor wrote, "Parliamentary camaraderie...I had the pleasure of sharing his joy after five years of being seated on the same bench in the Lok Sabha in the previous term." A user commented, "This is how we want...parliamentarians across the party lines to be."

271.title: Warden of children's home in TN arrested after minor boys allege sexual abuse
271.article_body: The 36-year-old warden of a children's home in Tamil Nadu's Tiruvannamalai was arrested for allegedly sexually abusing minor boys residing at the home for past three months. Seven minor boys had reportedly called children's helpline number 1098 to report the crime. The home's owner was also arrested for neither reporting the alleged crime nor taking action against it, police said.

272.title: I gave all my time to work, forgot my family was waiting for me: Aamir Khan
272.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said that he has given all his time to his work and that he thought that his family was with him anyway. "I just wanted to win the hearts of the audience at the time. And, I got completely lost, so much so that I forgot my family was waiting for me," Aamir said.

273.title: Centre allows Sikh passengers to wear kirpan on Indian flights
273.article_body: Civil Aviation Ministry has modified an earlier order restricting Sikh passengers from wearing kirpan on flights and allowed them to do so on an "Indian aircraft within India". Kirpan's total length shouldn't exceed 22.86 cm, it said. BJP leader Manjinder Singh Sirsa shared the corrigendum's picture and thanked PM Narendra Modi and Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia for their "swift action".

274.title: Hard to digest: Pak captain Maroof on their 4th straight loss in Women's WC
274.article_body: Pakistan captain Bismah Maroof expressed disappointment after they suffered their fourth straight loss in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup. "Very hard to digest. Some bad shots from the middle-order cost us the game [against Bangladesh]," she stated. Meanwhile, Bangladesh captain Nigar Sultana said she can't even describe the feeling after registering their first-ever win in Women's World Cup.

275.title: AirAsia's Bengaluru-Kolkata flight makes emergency landing in Bhubaneswar, man dies
275.article_body: An AirAsia Bengaluru-Kolkata flight made an emergency landing at Biju Patnaik International Airport in Bhubaneswar after a passenger fell ill mid-flight on Sunday morning. The airport authorities dispatched an ambulance ahead of time to transport the patient to the hospital. However, the passenger could not be saved and was declared dead at the Capital Hospital.

276.title: Unattended bag inside Delhi-bound train triggers bomb scare; bomb squad called
276.article_body: A fire was reported in a train travelling to Delhi from Haryana. An unattended bag, a pouch and a container were found inside a coach. Police said the pouch containing about 2 kilograms of nails had caught fire due to friction. A bomb disposal squad reached the spot after getting information. Police claimed the bag may belong to a carpenter.

277.title: There has been improvement in Pant's method: Irfan Pathan
277.article_body: Praising wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant, Irfan Pathan said there has been improvement in the 24-year-old's method. "Earlier, Pant used to play shots only on the leg side but now plays shots on the off-side as well...He now tries to find a way to stay on the pitch, doesn't only hit," added Irfan. Pant scored 185 runs in two Sri Lanka Tests.

278.title: Ukraine Prez meets injured soldiers in hospital, hands them medals
278.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday visited a military hospital in Kyiv to meet injured soldiers and handed them medals for their service to the country. A video of Zelenskyy interacting with the soldiers has been shared online. "Guys, get well soon. I believe that the best gift for your statement will be our common victory!" Zelenskyy said.

279.title: Nothing like that: Kartik on being asked if someone in B'wood is 'harassing' him
279.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, during his interaction with media at the Iconic Gold Awards 2022, was asked if someone in Bollywood was 'harassing' him. "There is nothing like that. Nobody is bothering me," he said. Kartik was reportedly fired from Dharma Productions' 'Dostana 2' last year due to 'unprofessional behaviour'. Kartik will be next seen in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

280.title: Pregnant Ukrainian woman whose rescue pic was shared widely dies in another Russian attack
280.article_body: A pregnant woman and her baby have died after Russia bombed the maternity hospital where she was meant to give birth. Earlier, photos of the woman being rushed to an ambulance on a stretcher were widely shared worldwide. Realising that she was losing her baby, she cried out to medics, "Kill me now!" Both she and her baby later died.

281.title: Bangladesh win a Women's World Cup match for the first time, defeat Pakistan
281.article_body: Bangladesh defeated Pakistan by nine runs to register their first-ever victory in a Women's World Cup match. Fargana Hoque top-scored as Bangladesh put up a total of 234/7. Pakistan were restricted to 225/9 despite Sidra Ameen's 104(140). Bangladesh's Fahima Khatun picked up three wickets. Pakistan have lost each of their first four 2022 Women's World Cup matches so far.

282.title: 2 boys hold poster reading 'Rohit is not my captain, reinstate Kohli', pic goes viral
282.article_body: A picture has gone viral on social media showing two boys holding a poster reading 'Rohit is not my captain, reinstate Kohli' during India-Sri Lanka Day-Night Test at M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru. After facing criticism from a certain section of fans, the boys' father tweeted, "Guys relax...that was for Tests only...Rohit is no doubt 'GOAT' in white-ball cricket."

283.title: Request to wear yellow turbans, shawls for swearing-in ceremony: Mann
283.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's Bhagwant Mann, who will take oath as the Chief Minister of Punjab on March 16 requested public to reach Khatkar Kalan for the ceremony. "I request my brothers to wear yellow turbans that day and sisters to drape yellow shawls/stoles. We will colour Khatkar Kalan in 'Basanti rang' that day," he added.

284.title: 7 killed in fire at chemical plant in China
284.article_body: As many as seven people were reportedly killed after a fire broke out at a chemical plant in China on Monday. The accident occurred during some maintenance activity at Bao Gang United Steel plant in the country's Inner Mongolia region. After reaching the site, the rescue team found that seven people were missing, all of whom were later found dead.

285.title: 'Pushpa' actress Rashmika in talks for a song in Ranbir's 'Animal': Reports
285.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna, who was recently seen in 'Pushpa: The Rise', is reportedly in talks for a special song in 'Animal', an upcoming action film starring Ranbir Kapoor. It will be directed by 'Kabir Singh' fame director Sandeep Reddy Vanga and will also feature Parineeti Chopra, Bobby Deol and Anil Kapoor. 'Animal' is expected to release on August 11, 2023.

286.title: At least 596 civilians killed since Russia attacked Ukraine
286.article_body: The Office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights said that at least 596 civilians including 43 children have been killed in Ukraine since Russia's attack. The number of those injured stood at 1,067 including 57 children, it added. Most of the casualties were caused by the use of explosive weapons including shelling, missiles and airstrikes, it said.

287.title: I still own & won't sell my Bitcoin, Ethereum or Doge: Elon Musk
287.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "I still own and won't sell my Bitcoin, Ethereum or Doge." However, he added, "As a general principle...It's generally better...to own physical things like a home or stock in companies you think make good products...than dollars when inflation is high." Bitcoin, Ether and Doge prices saw a brief spike after Musk's tweet.

288.title: Had Emirati wedding with Rubina in Abu Dhabi: Abhinav Shukla on 'Wanderlust'
288.article_body: Actor Abhinav Shukla, while talking about series 'Wanderlust' said that he had an Emirati wedding with his wife and actress Rubina Dilaik in Abu Dhabi. "We were dressed like the local...groom and the bride. And we were, we are a very close experience of how it would be locationally...getting married...in that style...that was memorable," Abhinav added.

289.title: ITBP official martyred, head constable injured in IED blast in Chhattisgarh
289.article_body: An official of the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) was martyred and a head constable suffered injuries when a pressure improvised explosive device (IED) planted by Naxals exploded in Chhattisgarh's Narayanpur on Monday, police said. The incident took place when a team of ITBP's 53rd battalion was out on patrolling duty to ensure security to a road construction work, police added.

290.title: PM Modi is a man of tremendous vigour and dynamism: Shashi Tharoor
290.article_body: Congress' Shashi Tharoor said PM Narendra Modi is a man of "tremendous vigour and dynamism". "The PM has done some things which are very impressive, especially politically. We didn't expect him to win with such great margins, but he did," he said. "The Indian voter has the capacity to surprise...but right now they've given BJP what they wanted," Tharoor added.

291.title: I love Jadeja's game among the new cricketers: Kapil Dev
291.article_body: Ex-India captain Kapil Dev has said he loves all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's game among the new cricketers. "Jadeja plays without pressure. He enjoys cricket. That's why he's good at bowling as well as batting. He also does a great job in fielding," stated Kapil. Jadeja smashed unbeaten 175 and picked a total of nine wickets in first Test against Sri Lanka.

292.title: 35-yr-old man charred to death after car catches fire in Bengaluru
292.article_body: A 35-year-old man was charred to death after his car accidentally caught fire on Bengaluru's NICE Road, police said. According to police, the man had pulled his car to a side and was trying to get out after he noticed the fire in the AC vent. A passerby had rushed to help the deceased when the car exploded, police added.

293.title: Taiwan's fighter jet crashes into sea; second incident in 3 months
293.article_body: A Taiwanese fighter jet crashed into the sea off its southeast coast, said the presidential office on Monday. The French-built Mirage 2000 aircraft was on a training mission from the Chihhang air base in Taitung. The pilot was reported to be safe after parachuting out of the crashing plane. In January, an F-16 jet crashed, killing the pilot.

294.title: A top industrialist asked me to sleep with his wife at my nightclub: Tehseen Poonawalla
294.article_body: Venture Capitalist and political analyst Tehseen Poonawalla, revealed in the reality show 'Lock Upp', that a top industrialist once asked him to sleep with his wife. "He booked my entire nightclub for [weekend]. His condition was that he wanted to see me sleeping with his wife." Tehseen further said that he did it as the industrialist watched.

295.title: Delhi Police personnel save 20-year-old law student who jumped into Yamuna river
295.article_body: Three Delhi Police personnel jumped into Yamuna river to save a 20-year-old law student who tried to kill himself after failing in one of his exams. The student belongs to Rajasthan's Alwar and studies at National Law School of India University, Bengaluru. Officials said Alwar police informed that a man will try to kill himself as he tweeted about it.

296.title: 15 arrested after several men sexually assault women in MP as onlookers recorded videos
296.article_body: As many as 15 people, including the prime accused, have been arrested after several men sexually assaulted two women on a street during the Bhagoria festival in Madhya Pradesh's Alirajpur. A video had surfaced online showing the men molesting the women one by one as onlookers recorded videos on their phones.

297.title: Maha board's Class 12 Chemistry paper leaked; coaching centre owner arrested
297.article_body: The Class 12 chemistry paper of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education has allegedly been leaked in Mumbai. Police in Vile Parle have arrested a teacher, who is the owner of a coaching centre in Malad, in connection with the paper leak. The accused allegedly shared the paper on a WhatsApp group before the exam, police said.

298.title: 6.7-magnitude earthquake hits Indonesia's Sumatra; no casualties reported
298.article_body: An earthquake of 6.7 magnitude struck Indonesia's Sumatra island on Monday prompting residents to flee homes. The epicentre was located at about 167 km from the coastal city of Pariaman, as per US Geological Survey. No loss of life or other damages were reported. The authorities initially warned of a potential tsunami but later lifted the warning.

299.title: Bees attack 200 tourists at Pune's Shivneri Fort, 25 hospitalised
299.article_body: At least 200 tourists were stung by bees at Shivneri Fort in Pune on Sunday. State forest department officials said that at least 25 tourists were hospitalised and discharged after primary treatment at a local government hospital. "Swarms of bees from at least three beehives located near the main entrance of the fort were galvanised," an official said.

300.title: Paytm shares fall to all-time low of ₹672 after RBI curbs on Paytm Payments Bank
300.article_body: The shares of Paytm fell more than 12% to hit an all-time low of ₹672 on the BSE in Monday's early deals. This comes after Reserve Bank of India (RBI) barred Paytm Payments Bank from onboarding new customers until its audit is done. The stock has declined around 70% compared to its issue price of ₹2,150 per share.

301.title: It's not just attack, attack, there's a lot of method to it: Jaffer on Pant's batting
301.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said there's a lot of method to Rishabh Pant's attacking batting. "Pant comes out and attacks...he puts the (opposition) team on the back foot, and then he plays the waiting game and then surprises with his attacking shots," Jaffer explained. Pant smashed the fastest fifty by an Indian in Tests while playing against Sri Lanka.

302.title: I've absolutely no regrets: Asha Parekh on not getting married
302.article_body: Veteran actress Asha Parekh has featured on the cover of Harper's Bazaar India for its 13th-anniversary issue. The 79-year-old actress opened up about not getting married and said, "I guess I wasn't destined to get married." "Honestly, I'd have loved to get married and have children...but it wasn't meant to be...However, I've absolutely no regrets," Asha told Harper's Bazaar India.

303.title: Obama tests COVID-19 +ve, PM Modi wishes him a quick recovery
303.article_body: Former US President Barack Obama on Sunday said that he has tested positive for coronavirus, while his wife Michelle has tested negative. Following this, PM Narendra Modi extended his wishes for Obama's quick recovery and for his family's good health and wellbeing. Obama added that both he and his wife are "grateful to be vaccinated and boosted" against the virus.

304.title: 4 devotees killed, 16 hurt after truck hits tractor-trolley in Maha
304.article_body: Four people were killed and 16 others were injured after a truck hit a tractor-trolley carrying devotees on Solapur-Pune highway near Maharashtra's Kondi village, police said on Monday. The truck's driver lost control after a tyre burst, following which the incident had occurred, a police official said. The devotees were travelling to Pandharpur to celebrate 'Ekadashi', a police official added.

305.title: CPI MP gives notice to discuss slashing of interest rates on EPF
305.article_body: The Communist Party of India (CPI) Rajya Sabha MP Binoy Viswam gave a suspension of business notice under rule 267 to discuss the decision of slashing of interest rates on EPF (Employees' Provident Fund) in Rajya Sabha. "The decision of EPFO to slash interest rates will result in significant monetary losses to 60 million salaried class subscribers," the notice read.

306.title: Man handcuffs himself to door of McDonald's outlet in Russia, pic surfaces
306.article_body: A man identified as pianist Luca Zatravkin handcuffed himself to the entrance door of a McDonald's outlet in Russia after McDonald's announced it is temporarily shutting down all its restaurants in Russia amid war with Ukraine. "They don't need to shut it down. What's their reason for shutting down?" he said. He was later arrested by the police.

307.title: Treat people well at police station, offer senior citizens water: Mumbai CP
307.article_body: Sanjay Pandey, Commissioner of Police, Mumbai, told Mumbai Police personnel to treat people well at the police stations. "If we don't behave with people properly and use berating language, it will tarnish our image. If any senior citizen comes to our police station, we should offer him a glass of water," he said, adding, "Every complainant should be treated equally."

308.title: IMD issues heatwave alert in Mumbai, Thane, Raigad for next 2 days
308.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert with a warning of a heatwave in Thane, Mumbai, Raigad and north Konkan for the next two days. While the maximum temperature in Mumbai is likely to rise to 39 degrees Celsius, the minimum temperature is forecasted to rise to 24 degrees Celsius. Mumbai recorded 38.6 degrees Celsius on Sunday.

309.title: Didn't join politics to check prices of aloo, tamatar: Pakistan PM Imran Khan
309.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan has said he didn't join politics to check the prices of 'aloo, tamatar', as he attacked the Opposition for tabling a no-confidence motion against him. The 69-year-old cricketer-turned-politician said that 25 years ago, he decided to join politics for the sake of the country's youth, adding that he had no personal gains from doing so.

310.title: 2 found dead in Worli, suicide suspected: Mumbai Police
310.article_body: The Mumbai Police said it has recovered two bodies, both suspected to have died by suicide in Worli on Sunday. According to the officials, one was found hanging from a tree while the other was found near Worli Sea Face. The bodies have been sent to the Nair Hospital for post-mortem, police said.

311.title: Gr Noida’s Kisan Chowk to get underpass, work to begin in 5-6 months: GNIDA
311.article_body: In order to tackle traffic congestion, the Greater Noida authority will finalise a tender to construct an underpass at Kisan Chowk in the next three months, said an official. The authority said the work is expected to begin in the next five to six months and the underpass will be ready in two years after that.

312.title: Arsenal move into top four, Chelsea defeat Newcastle in Premier League
312.article_body: Arsenal moved into Premier League's top four with a 2-0 win over Leicester City on Sunday night. Arsenal, with 51 points, have three games in hand on Manchester United, who are now placed fifth with 50 points. Meanwhile, Chelsea remain on third after their 1-0 win against Newcastle United. Manchester City are at the top with 69 points.

313.title: Russia asked for military equipment from China for its war in Ukraine: Report
313.article_body: Russia has asked China for military assistance including drones amid its ongoing war in Ukraine, a top US official cited by CNN broadcaster said. However, Liu Pengyu, the Chinese embassy spokesperson in Washington, said he was unaware of any suggestions that China might be willing to help Russia. Meanwhile, US warned China there would be consequences if it helped Russia.

314.title: 2 newly-elected councillors belonging to TMC, Cong shot dead in West Bengal
314.article_body: Two newly-elected councillors, one belonging to TMC and another to Congress, were shot dead by unidentified miscreants in separate incidents in West Bengal. While TMC blamed BJP for councillor Anupam Dutta's killing in Panihati, Congress has held TMC responsible for Congress councillor Tapan Kandu's murder in Jhalda. "Law and order [situation] is crumbling in Bengal," BJP's Suvendu Adhikari said.

315.title: Kangana once met astrologer, he said she's going to be a heroine: Prabhas
315.article_body: Actor Prabhas, during an interview about his new film 'Radhe Shyam', said that actress Kangana Ranaut had once met an astrologer who told her she's going to be a heroine. Prabhas added that Kangana felt that the astrologer was fooling her and she did not pay much attention to his prediction. Prabhas can be seen playing palmist in 'Radhe Shyam'.

316.title: BSF deputy commandant dies after fall during training in WB
316.article_body: A BSF deputy commandant died on Sunday during a physical training programme in West Bengal's Baishnabnagar, a BSF statement said. According to the statement, Ajit Singh Tanwar had complained of chest pain after he lost his balance and fell on the ground. Tanwar, who's aged 55, was taken to a hospital where he was declared brought dead, the statement added.

317.title: Man saved from falling into gap between platform, train in Mumbai's Wadala
317.article_body: An RPF constable saved a man from falling into gap between the platform and the train at Wadala station in Mumbai on Sunday. "Timely act of RPF constable Netrapal Singh, saved the life of a passenger who slipped and fell down while boarding running local train at Wadala station...Passengers are requested not to board/de-board a moving train," Central Railway tweeted.

318.title: Feels good: Jasprit Bumrah on 1st five-wicket haul on Indian soil
318.article_body: Talking about his first five-wicket haul in his fourth Test match on Indian soil, Jasprit Bumrah said it feels good to have contributed towards the team's success in the ongoing second Test against Sri Lanka. "When you play all three formats, you have to look after your body and you sometimes miss out on the home Tests," he added.

319.title: Who won what at BAFTA Film Awards 2022?
319.article_body: Jane Campion-directorial 'The Power of the Dog' was named the Best Film at BAFTA Awards 2022. Will Smith won the Best Actor award for 'King Richard' and Joanna Scanlan won the Best Actress award for 'After Love'. Ariana DeBose was named Best Supporting Actress, while Troy Kotsur won the Best Supporting Actor award. 'Dune' also clinched Best Cinematography award.

320.title: Delhi govt seeks monkey experts to check menace at Vidhan Sabha
320.article_body: In a bid to control the disturbance caused by monkeys at the Vidhan Sabha complex, the Delhi government has floated a tender seeking experts in primate psychology. "Some officials nearly got bitten… monkeys snatch food, files from employees… they jump on cars parked in the complex and damage them," said an official working at the Vidhan Sabha.

321.title: 'Avengers: Endgame', 'Body Heat' actor William Hurt passes away at 71
321.article_body: Actor William Hurt, who played Thaddeus Ross in 'Avengers: Endgame' and 'Captain America: Civil War', has passed away at the age of 71. The Academy Award-winning actor died on March 13, one week before his 72nd birthday, of natural causes, his son Will said. William was also known for his roles in 'Body Heat' and 'Kiss of the Spider Woman'.

322.title: Woman, 3-yr-old son die as motorcycle falls into canal in Haryana
322.article_body: A 27-year-old woman, Manju, and her three-year-old son, Yatin, drowned to death after motorcycle they were riding fell into canal in Haryana's Fatehabad. The woman's husband sustained injuries in the incident. Spokesperson of Fatehabad police said that passersby rescued the woman's husband. The motorcycle was also fished out from the canal. Efforts are being made to retrieve bodies of deceased.

323.title: There was no one: Aamir Khan on rumours he divorced Kiran as he was dating someone
323.article_body: Aamir Khan refuted rumours that he and Kiran Rao got divorced as he was dating someone. "Our relationship of husband and wife experienced a certain change and we wanted to respect...institution of marriage," he said. Aamir also clarified he didn’t divorce his first wife Reena Dutta because of Kiran, saying he and Kiran became friends after his divorce with Reena.

324.title: In a first, BJD forms Zilla Parishads in all 30 districts of Odisha
324.article_body: The ruling Biju Janata Dal (BJD) has become the first party to form Zilla Parishads in all 30 districts of Odisha. "This is an unprecedented victory for BJD and the result of the faith of the voters in the leadership of CM Naveen Patnaik," party leader Pinaki Misra said. He added that 70% of the Zilla Parishad Presidents are women.

325.title: Zelenskyy urges NATO for no-fly zone after Russian attack near Polish border kills 35
325.article_body: A day after 35 people were killed in a Russian missile attack on a military base near Polish border in Ukraine, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urged NATO to impose a no-fly zone in a video statement. "If you don't close our sky, it is only a matter of time before Russian rockets fall on your territory, on NATO territory," he said.

326.title: India reports 2,503 new COVID-19 cases, 27 deaths in 24 hours
326.article_body: India has reported 2,503 new COVID-19 cases and 27 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country reported 3,116 cases and 47 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 36,168, while the death toll in the country reached 5,15,877.

327.title: 50-yr-old shrine vandalised, painted saffron in Madhya Pradesh; FIR lodged
327.article_body: A 50-year-old shrine located near Hoshangabad on Madhya Pradesh State Highway 22 was allegedly vandalised and painted saffron by unidentified miscreants. The shrine's caretaker alleged the wooden doors of the shrine were broken open and a hand pump inside the compound was uprooted. "We've registered an FIR, but our priority is to restore the shrine first," a police officer said.

328.title: 50 new bus routes started in Pune amid MSRTC workers' strike: Report
328.article_body: Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) has started over 50 routes across and outside the district in the last two months amid the ongoing Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) workers' strike, reported Hindustan Times. A PMPML traffic manager said that the new routes have been started following demands from people in rural areas and local representatives.

329.title: Hyderabad Police arrest 4 people, recover 1.2 kg ganja from them
329.article_body: Hyderabad Police have arrested four people and have seized 1.2 kg ganja from them. Police, while sharing details of case, said that Bowenpally Police had found circumstances of seven people suspicious. Police said that the seven people tried to run away from the spot but the police chased and caught two people. Three cellphones and three bikes have been recovered.

330.title: Lady Gaga, Selena Gomez walk red carpet at Critics Choice Awards
330.article_body: Several celebrities, including Lady Gaga and Selena Gomez, walked the red carpet at the 27th annual Critics Choice Awards 2022. Gaga opted for a black-and-gold Gucci ensemble, styled by Tom Erebout and Sandra Amador. Meanwhile, Selena wore a Louis Vuitton gown at the ceremony, where she was nominated for Best Actress in Comedy Series for 'Only Murders in the Building'.

331.title: Messi, Neymar booed by own fans in 1st match after Champions League exit
331.article_body: After PSG's 2-3 aggregate loss to Real Madrid in Champions League, Neymar and Lionel Messi were booed by their own fans throughout their Ligue 1 game against Bordeaux. "I feel sad about what I saw," said coach Mauricio Pochettino. Kylian Mbappe, who was the only scorer for PSG in their Champions League tie against Madrid, was applauded in the match.

332.title: Man seeking ₹3 lakh loan cheated of ₹6.3 lakh in Pune
332.article_body: A 38-year-old man from Pune who was promised a personal loan of ₹3 lakh was allegedly cheated of ₹6.3 lakh by callers. The victim was asked to pay money in smaller amounts over nine months on the pretext of processing fees, an insurance and advance EMIs, said police, adding he was also promised an increase in loan amount.

333.title: 3 Delhi Police personnel assault traffic inspector after being asked to move car; held
333.article_body: Three Delhi Police personnel have been arrested for allegedly assaulting a traffic police inspector in Delhi's Hauz Khas area. According to police, the inspector had asked the accused to move their car as it was parked on the wrong side of the road, but the latter got angry and allegedly attacked him. Victim claimed one of the policemen slapped him.

334.title: Rickshaw driver arrested for running over pedestrian in Pune
334.article_body: A 29-year-old rickshaw driver was arrested for allegedly running over a pedestrian, a 21-year-old businessman, in Pune. According to police, the victim ignored some questions from the rickshaw driver after which the latter got enraged and ran the vehicle over him. The victim reportedly sustained a fractured hand and backbone among other injuries.

335.title: Pune MBA student cheated of ₹1L over 'work from home' job, 3 booked
335.article_body: At least three people were booked following a cheating case in which a 23-year-old MBA student in Maharashtra's Pune was defrauded of ₹1.38 lakh last year on pretext of a 'work from home' job. Police said the victim found the job on social media and was initially paid for some assignments before being asked to pay for a bigger assignment.

336.title: 2 fans take selfie with Virat Kohli after invading ground, pics go viral
336.article_body: Two fans breached security and invaded the ground while Sri Lanka's Kusal Mendis was taking treatment after being hit by a Mohammad Shami delivery in the sixth over of their second innings. The fans took a selfie with Virat Kohli before being escorted out by security personnel. The match is being held at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.

337.title: Fan invades ground before being chased by around 10 officials during India-SL Test
337.article_body: A fan invaded the ground during India-Sri Lanka Test at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru during a break forced by a medical issue to Kusal Mendis. The fan was seen running towards Virat Kohli as around 10 security officials chased him. He ran towards the other side of the ground before eventually being caught.

338.title: Mumbai targets net-zero carbon emissions by 2050; 2 decades ahead of India's target
338.article_body: Mumbai has announced a Climate Action Plan to eliminate carbon emissions by 2050. Mumbai has proposed exhaustive changes to the way it manages energy, water, air, waste, green spaces and transport for its 19 million residents. Mumbai's target puts it two decades ahead of India's national goal, as the country has promised to cut its emissions to net-zero by 2070.

339.title: Confident of BJP's win in MP Assembly elections 2023: Scindia
339.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has claimed that "BJP will win" in the Madhya Pradesh Assembly elections next year. He said, "MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan is working day and night for the people's welfare and I am sure BJP will win." When asked about the Congress, Scindia said, "Congress was my past and don't want to waste time on it."

340.title: 5 Indian students aged between 21 and 24 killed in road accident in Canada
340.article_body: Five Indian students aged between 21 and 24 were killed, while two others were hospitalised after a road accident near Toronto, India's High Commissioner to Canada Ajay Bisaria said. The passenger van in which the students were travelling collided with a tractor trailer. The deceased students were identified as Harpreet Singh, Jaspinder Singh, Karanpal Singh, Mohit Chouhan and Pawan Kumar.

341.title: Woman thanks Bengaluru police for helping her escape barking dogs on road
341.article_body: A woman named Seema Khan took to Twitter to share an incident when a female inspector helped her escape "barking dogs" while Khan was returning to her hostel late at night in Bengaluru's Banaswadi. "Inspector Sheela took me to my hostel safely...I really want to share this...for girls who need any help," Khan wrote. "Very thankful," Khan captioned her post.

342.title: MoS Chandrasekhar reviews Gallium Nitride tech centre in Bengaluru
342.article_body: A press release said on Sunday that Union Minister of State for Electronics and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar has visited Gallium Nitride Ecosystem Enabling Centre and Incubator facility at IISc Bengaluru. "The next two-three years [offer] a window of opportunity for Gallium Nitride to play a key role in enabling e-vehicles and wireless communication," he said after reviewing the work there.

343.title: Someone asked me 'Is Jalsa a biopic on Amitabh Bachchan's house': Vidya
343.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan said that someone asked her if her upcoming movie 'Jalsa' was a biopic on actor Amitabh Bachchan's house which goes by the same name. "I said 'you will have to wait for the answer to this question'," Vidya said, adding, "Because what do you say, how can it be the biopic of a house?"

344.title: Mumbai 1st South Asian city to announce net-zero emission roadmap
344.article_body: Maharashtra Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday announced detailed plans to make Mumbai a net-zero carbon emitter by 2050, making it the first South Asian city to do so. Putting Mumbai two decades ahead of India's national goal, the plan proposes large-scale changes in six domains. Flood-resistant drainage and investment in housing and sanitation are some of the proposed changes.

345.title: Amazon moves staff from Seattle office amid rise in violent crimes
345.article_body: Amazon is temporarily relocating employees from a downtown Seattle office amid an increase in violent crime in the area. There have been at least three shootings, two stabbings and one carjacking in the area since February 21, according to the Seattle Police Department's Twitter account. Amazon said it is providing employees currently at that location with alternative office space elsewhere.

346.title: Police recover 6 kg 'charas' worth ₹1.95 cr from peddler in Mumbai
346.article_body: Police on Sunday arrested a drug peddler from Mumbai's Dahisar area and recovered over 6 kg of 'charas' worth ₹1.95 crore in the international market. "Yesterday, we received information that a person is arriving with some narcotics substance...A court has remanded him to police custody till March 17," said Deputy Commissioner of Police (Zone 12 Mumbai) Somnath Gharge.

347.title: Govt must enrol us in colleges here: HP student back from Ukraine
347.article_body: A student from Himachal Pradesh, who returned to India from Ukraine, has sought the Central Government's intervention in helping the students complete their medical degrees in the country. Kashika Mahajan, who was a fourth-year student in Ukraine, said that students hope that the government makes special arrangements to enrol the students in medical colleges in India.

348.title: Minor among 8 booked for performing wheelies in K'taka, bikes seized
348.article_body: Eight people, including a minor, were booked for allegedly performing motorbike stunts on the streets of Karnataka's Mangaluru and the police also seized five two-wheelers.
