Police received multiple complaints from locals informing that the youths were performing stunts and four different cases were registered. Police found vehicles' registration numbers after monitoring social media.

349.title: Yogi will take UP to greater heights of development: PM Modi
349.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday met Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath and said that he "will take the state to greater heights of development". In a tweet, PM Modi wrote, "Congratulating him (Yogi Adityanath) on the historic victory in the Uttar Pradesh elections. In the last five years, he has worked tirelessly to fulfil the aspirations of the people."

350.title: 4 arrested for looting petrol pumps in Meghalaya; gun, machete seized
350.article_body: The Meghalaya Police have arrested four people for their alleged involvement in looting petrol pumps across the state, an officer said. Police on Friday raided a hideout of the accused and recovered an AK-47 rifle, 14 live rounds of ammunition, a machete and a motorcycle, Superintendent of Police of East Jaintia Hills, Jagpal Singh Dhanoa said on Saturday.

351.title: Newborn baby stolen from govt hospital in Tamil Nadu, 2 detained
351.article_body: A man and a woman in their 30s have been detained for allegedly stealing a newborn baby from a government hospital in Tamil Nadu's Kancheepuram district. The baby's mother had reportedly gone to the washroom leaving the baby in another patient's care and found the child missing after returning. The accused pair were later caught at a bus stop.

352.title: Int'l Yoga Day to be held at 75 heritage, cultural sites this year
352.article_body: Union Ayush Minister Sarbananda Sonowal on Sunday inaugurated the Yoga Mahotsav 2022 to mark 100 days countdown to the 8th International Day of Yoga. The event will be held at 75 iconic heritage and cultural sites on International Yoga Day on June 21. "It's an opportunity to promote health, wellbeing and peace across the globe," Sonowal said in his address.

353.title: ₹2 cr to be spent on Bhagwant Mann's swearing-in as Punjab CM: Cong
353.article_body: Congress' official media platform on Sunday claimed that ₹2 crore will be spent on Bhagwant Mann's swearing-in as Punjab Chief Minister. "Bhagwant Mann is eager to empty the treasury of Punjab as soon as he arrives," the post said. Congress MLA Sukhpal Singh Khaira called it a "gross misuse of public exchequer" and said that it was "unacceptable."

354.title: 2.5 kg heroin recovered by STF in Punjab's Ludhiana, 4 arrested
354.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) Punjab on Sunday arrested four drug peddlers in Ludhiana and recovered 2.5 kilograms of heroin. Ludhiana STF in charge, Inspector Harbans Singh said that they caught the accused while they were travelling in a car near Golden Avenue on Dhandra road following a tip-off. "The accused hold a long criminal record", he added.

355.title: It'll be challenging for SL on Day 3 of Day-Night Test vs India: Vihari
355.article_body: India batter Hanuma Vihari said it'll be difficult for Sri Lanka on Day 3 of the Day-Night Test in Bengaluru after being 28/1 at stumps on Day 2, needing 419 more runs to win. "It was quite challenging [today]. A kind of wicket where any ball could get you out," he added. India declared their second innings at 303/9.

356.title: World no. 12 Lakshya loses to world no. 20 Vitidsarn in German Open final
356.article_body: World Championships bronze medallist Lakshya Sen lost to world number 20 Kunlavut Vitidsarn in the final at German Open in Mülheim an der Ruhr on Sunday. The 20-year-old Indian shuttler was beaten 21-18, 21-15 by the Thai player in 57 minutes. World number 12 Lakshya had defeated world number one and Olympic champion Viktor Axelsen in the semi-finals on Saturday.

357.title: Scindia inaugurates FlyBig Airlines' Indore-Gondia-Hyderabad flight
357.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia inaugurated FlyBig airlines' Indore-Gondia-Hyderabad flight route virtually at an event on Sunday. The services will be run under UDAN Regional Connectivity Scheme. "Indore needs to be connected with other smaller cities," Scindia said, adding, there are plans for smaller planes and helicopters to connect cities across the country "till the last mile".

358.title: Kazakhstan's Anti-Corruption Agency detains former President's nephew
358.article_body: Kazakhstan's Anti-Corruption Agency on Sunday detained former President Nursultan Nazarbayev's nephew, Kairat Satybaldy in connection to an embezzlement probe at communications firm Kazakhtelecom. Nazarbayev and many of his relatives were removed from top posts by his successor and current President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev after protests over fuel prices turned violent killing 225 people in January.

359.title: No foreign military personnel present in Maldives: Defence Ministry
359.article_body: The Maldivian Defence Ministry said on Saturday that there's no armed foreign military personnel present in the country. No foreign parties would be active at the Uthuru Thilafalhu (UTF) base, where the Maldives National Defence Force (MNDF)’s Coast Guard dock and dockyard are being developed, reports stated. This comes amid the Maldivian Opposition's 'India Out' campaign.

360.title: World beater: Jaffer on Pant scoring fastest 50 for India in Tests
360.article_body: Calling Rishabh Pant a "world beater" after he scored fastest Test fifty by an Indian against Sri Lanka in Day-Night Test, Wasim Jaffer said the frequency with which India wicketkeeper-batter produces such knocks is incredible. "Usually if a batter is mercurial he's not consistent. But in Pant we've a mercurial batter who's consistent," he added. Pant scored a 28 ball-50.

361.title: We should take lead in 6G technology: Ashwini Vaishnaw
361.article_body: Communications Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Sunday said, "[India] should take the lead in 6G technology. Otherwise, what's the point of being a nation which is...called a talent nation." "We have already initiated work on 6G also, as we have made very good progress on 4G and 5G," he added. India's 5G spectrum auction may take place in May, PTI reported.

362.title: MP man dies, wife injured after being attacked by drug addict son
362.article_body: A 50-year-old man died and his wife sustained severe injuries after being attacked by their drug addict son in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior. The accused, Neeraj Kushwaha, was reportedly demanding money for drugs from his father for the last three days but was refused. On Sunday, he came home in an inebriated state and beat his parents with a stick.

363.title: Crashed drone that apparently flew from Ukraine carried a bomb: Croatia
363.article_body: A military drone that apparently flew from Ukraine and crashed in the Croatian capital, Zagreb, was carrying a bomb, Croatia's Defence Minister Mario Banožić said on Sunday. This further raises a question about whether the drone belonged to Russia or Ukraine, he added. The Soviet-era drone had flown over Romania and Hungary, both NATO-member states, before entering Croatia.

364.title: 'Bachchhan Paandey' is a fun film: Jacqueline Fernandez
364.article_body: Talking about 'Bachchhan Paandey', actress Jacqueline Fernandez said, "It's a fun film...I'm there for a cute little appearance." Jacqueline further said that she worked with actors Arshad Warsi and Kriti Sanon for the first time and added, "It was a nice experience." "With Kriti, I just had one day, but that was really a memorable one," she stated.

365.title: Actor Pulkit Samrat shares pictures from the set of 'Fukrey 3'
365.article_body: Actor Pulkit Samrat took to Instagram and shared pictures from the set of his upcoming film 'Fukrey 3'. "Fukrey 3 apki seva mein (Fukrey 3 at your service)," Pulkit captioned the post. The film is the third installation of the 2013 film 'Fukrey'. Actor Ali Fazal will reportedly not be part of 'Fukrey 3' due to scheduling issues.

366.title: China shuts tech hub over 66 COVID-19 cases, puts 17 mn people in lockdown
366.article_body: China on Sunday locked down one of its biggest cities with 17 million residents after 66 new COVID-19 infections were reported there. The southern Chinese tech hub of Shenzhen has told all its residents to stay at home to control an Omicron outbreak linked to Hong Kong. China's national cases reached a two-year high of nearly 3,400 on Sunday.

367.title: Ukrainian man learns his wife, 2 kids died after seeing their dead bodies on Twitter
367.article_body: A Ukrainian man named Serhiy Perebyinis learned about the death of his wife, and two kids, aged 18 and 9, after seeing the photos of their dead bodies on Twitter. They were killed by mortar fire last Sunday as they attempted to flee via a damaged bridge in Irpin. "I recognized their luggage," Perebyinis told The New York Times.

368.title: Russian court allows Peppa Pig piracy without punishment after Western sanctions
368.article_body: A Russian court has ruled that Peppa Pig's trademarks can be used by Russian businesses without punishment. Entertainment One, which owns the rights of the cartoon character had asked for 40,000 roubles in compensation from a Russian entrepreneur who had drawn his own version of the character. The court dismissed the case citing "unfriendly actions of US and affiliated countries."

369.title: Former Hyderabad captain Ravi Teja retires from first-class cricket
369.article_body: Former Hyderabad skipper Ravi Teja has retired from first-class cricket. The 34-year-old batter thanked his well-wishers for their constant support. Teja made his first-class debut in 2006. He represented Hyderabad and Meghalaya in domestic cricket. In his 16-year-long domestic career, Teja also represented India U-19, India A and the now-defunct IPL franchise Deccan Chargers.

370.title: Turkey & Greece leaders hold talks in rare meeting, discuss Ukraine
370.article_body: Greek PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan held talks in Istanbul on Sunday in a rare meeting between the two countries that have been at odds over several issues. They discussed bilateral issues, as well as the Russian invasion of Ukraine, according to a statement. "Turkey and Greece have...special responsibility in the European security architecture," it added.

371.title: Malaysia reports 26,250 COVID-19 cases, 77 deaths in a day
371.article_body: Malaysian Health Ministry reported 26,250 new COVID-19 cases as of Saturday midnight taking the total caseload to over 38 lakh since the pandemic began. As per data released by the ministry, 77 deaths were recorded in the same period bringing the total death toll to 33,720. Meanwhile, out of 26,250 cases, 545 were reported to be imported cases.

372.title: Nadal beats 21-yr-old Korda in 3 sets, says 'Lucky to be through'
372.article_body: Rafael Nadal defeated world number 38 Sebastian Korda 6-2, 1-6, 7-6(7-3) in the second round at Indian Wells. After winning the match by recovering from 2-5 down in the third set, Nadal said, "I feel very lucky today to be through. Sebastian was playing some fantastic tennis." Notably, Nadal is now undefeated in all 16 matches he played this year.

373.title: Sonia Gandhi will immediately take steps to revamp party: Congress
373.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi will immediately take up corrective measures to revamp and re-strengthen the party, AICC general secretary KC Venugopal said after Congress Working Committee meeting on Sunday. Congress will hold a 'Chintan Shivir' immediately after the Budget Session of Parliament, he said, adding that the CWC will meet before that. Former PM Manmohan Singh didn't attend the meeting.

374.title: Being social media influencer helped break child actor tag: Anushka
374.article_body: Anushka Sen has said that being a social media influencer has helped her break the tag of being a child actor. "Thanks to social media that people got to know the real me, the real Anushka...I don't think people just see me as a child actor," she stated. "I didn't realise when...transition happened because I was always working," she added.

375.title: Family growing: AAP as 16 Amritsar municipal councillors join party
375.article_body: Sixteen councillors of the Amritsar Municipal Corporation have joined AAP, the party tweeted from its official account on Sunday. "AAP family is growing...After winning Assembly, AAP's flag is now waving in municipal corporations too!" the tweet read. The councillors joined in the presence of party leader Manish Sisodia, AAP's Punjab in-charge Jarnail Singh and city Mayor Karamjit Singh Rintu.

376.title: 5 people rape 22-yr-old, record the act to blackmail her in Raj
376.article_body: A 22-year-old was allegedly gang-raped by five people in Rajasthan's Ajmer, who also recorded the act to blackmail her, police said on Sunday. A case was registered at Nasirabad Sadar Police Station and Circle Officer Poonam Bhargad said the woman, a resident of Nizampura, named three of the five accused in her complaint, which was lodged on Thursday.

377.title: China to face consequences if it helps Russia evade sanctions: US
377.article_body: Speaking to CNN, US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan said that China would face consequences if it helped Russia evade sweeping sanctions over the war in Ukraine. "We'll not allow...there to be a lifeline to Russia from these economic sanctions from any country," he added. Sullivan's remarks come ahead of his meeting with China's top diplomat Yang Jiechi on Monday.

378.title: 1.25 lakh evacuated via humanitarian corridors in Ukraine: Prez
378.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday said that nearly 1.25 lakh people have been evacuated via humanitarian corridors from conflict zones in Ukraine so far. He described providing relief to besieged Mariupol as a "key task", with a humanitarian supply convoy 80 kilometres away from the city. Supplies in Mariupol are running low amid a Russian blockade, local officials said.

379.title: K'taka lost ₹221 cr to cybercrimes in last 3 years: State Home Minister
379.article_body: Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra on Sunday said the state has lost ₹221.17 crore to cybercrimes in the last three years and only 21% of the amount has been recovered. Karnataka reported at least 32,286 cases between 2019-2022 and only 7,835 such cases have been solved. In the same period, only 75 persons have been convicted for cybercrime, Jnanendra added.

380.title: Cong lost in U'khand despite conducive environment: Ex-CM Rawat
380.article_body: Former Uttarakhand CM Harish Rawat on Sunday while taking responsibility for Congress' Assembly election defeat in the state "despite conducive environment", said the party needs to look into the reasons behind the "constant defeats". He added, "We'll work on suggestions for improvement that'll come in CWC." Congress won 19 seats in the 70-member state Assembly while BJP won 47 seats.

381.title: UK to criminalise sending unsolicited sexual pics on social media
381.article_body: The UK government has said that a law criminalising 'cyberflashing' or sending unsolicited sexual images to people through social media or dating apps, will be included in its Online Safety Bill. "Anyone who sends a photo or film of a person's genitals, for the purpose of their own sexual gratification...may face up to two years in prison," the government explained.

382.title: Every worker wants Rahul Gandhi to lead the party: Congress
382.article_body: After the Congress Working Committee (CWC) met over the party's poor performance in five states, Congress spokesperson Randeep Surjewala said every Congress worker wants Rahul Gandhi to lead the party. However, the new party president will be chosen at next Congress election, he added. Surjewala further said CWC wants Sonia Gandhi to guide the party till organisational elections are held.

383.title: Will always be special: Radhika on 2 years of 'Angrezi Medium'
383.article_body: Actress Radhika Madan on Sunday shared a series of stills from 'Angrezi Medium' on Instagram Stories to mark two years since its release, writing, "Will always be special". The film starred late actor Irrfan Khan. Radhika shared a picture with the late actor along with a heart emoji. The actress also shared a selfie from the first day of shoot.

384.title: He kept calling out my name in the hospital: Bappi Lahiri's son
384.article_body: Late veteran singer-composer Bappi Lahiri's son singer Bappa Lahiri has revealed that his father kept calling out his name when he was admitted to the hospital. Bappa added that he was not in India at the time and his father was supposed to visit him in the US soon. Bappi Lahiri passed away on February 15 aged 69 in Mumbai.

385.title: We know this boy: Suryakumar on Pant scoring fastest Test 50 by an Indian
385.article_body: After Rishabh Pant became the fastest half-centurion for India in Test cricket history, India batter Suryakumar Yadav tweeted, "We know this boy." The 24-year-old India wicketkeeper-batter scored a 28-ball 50 against Sri Lanka in the second and final Test in Bengaluru, breaking Kapil Dev's 40-year-old record. In 1982, Kapil had scored a fifty from 30 deliveries against Pakistan.

386.title: Congress will form 'aapki sarkar' in Haryana: Ex-CM Hooda
386.article_body: Former Haryana CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda, while addressing Congress workers on Sunday, said the party will form "aapki sarkar (your government)" in the state. He added, "Somebody will say...AAP...formed a government in Punjab. That's AAP party...not aapki (your) government." He also called to throw out the incumbent BJP-JJP government, saying, "Nobody can stop you if you stand united with me."

387.title: 24-year-old woman pilot flew back 800 Indian students amid Ukraine war
387.article_body: A 24-year-old pilot named Mahasweta Chakraborty flew 800 Indian students back to safety amid the Ukraine war. The Kolkata native reportedly flew six evacuation flights, four from Poland and two from Hungary, between February 27 and March 7. "I salute [the students'] fighting spirit and am extremely proud of having played my part in their journey back home," said Chakraborty.

388.title: Could have responded but observed restraint: Pak PM after India misfires missile
388.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Sunday said that they could have responded to India after its missile landed in their country but they "observed restraint". On March 9, an unarmed Indian missile landed in Pakistan, to which the former said that it was an "accidental firing". Later, Pakistan called for a joint probe "to establish the facts surrounding the incident."

389.title: India beat Germany 3-0 in a shootout at Women's Pro Hockey League
389.article_body: India beat Germany 3-0 in a shootout in second match of their two-legged tie as both teams were tied at 1-1 after 60-minute regulation time at FIH Women's Pro Hockey League in Bhubaneswar on Sunday. India had lost first match 1-2 in a shootout on Saturday. World number nine India secured two points from the match, including a bonus point.

390.title: Russia to ban Instagram tonight, users told to move their pics and videos
390.article_body: Russia has notified Instagram users in the country that the service will cease from midnight on Sunday, advising them to move their photos and videos from Instagram. Russians are being encouraged to switch to Russia's own "competitive internet platforms". This comes after Instagram parent Meta said it'd allow Ukraine users to post messages such as "Death to the Russian invaders".

391.title: 14 wickets fall on Day 2 as SL need 419 more runs to win D-N Test, India need 9 wickets
391.article_body: Sri Lanka ended the second day of the Day-Night Test in Bengaluru at 28/1 in their second innings, needing 419 more runs to win, while India need nine wickets to win. Earlier in the day, India declared their second innings at 303/9, setting Sri Lanka a target of 447. As many as 14 wickets fell on the second day.

392.title: 4 terrorists arrested in MP's Bhopal, were preparing sleeper cell
392.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Anti-Terrorism Squad arrested four suspected terrorists in Bhopal on Sunday and seized laptops and religious literature from their possession. They have been said to have links with banned outfit Jamat-e-Mujahideen Bangladesh, a government statement said. They were preparing a sleeper cell to conduct anti-national activities in the future, the statement added.

393.title: Getting eyeballs has been toughest, 'SOTY 2' changed things: Aditya
393.article_body: Actor Aditya Seal said "getting eyeballs" for his work has been the toughest for him in the industry. Aditya added that his films like 'Tum Bin 2' did not succeed because of many reasons like demonetisation. "Things changed with the release of 'Student Of The Year 2' (SOTY 2), it did manage to get people into the cinemas," he stated.

394.title: 179 Jharkhand students stranded in Ukraine return to state
394.article_body: As many as 179 students from Jharkhand who were stranded in Ukraine have returned to the state, officials confirmed on Sunday. Students from districts of Ranchi, East Singhbhum, Dhanbad, Godda, Palamu, Hazaribag and Bokaro, are among the evacuees. On February 25, the Jharkhand government had set up a control room to help families of those stuck in Ukraine.

395.title: Russia using phosphorus bombs that Nazis called 'flaming onion': Ukraine
395.article_body: Russian forces have been accused of using illegal phosphorus weapons in Ukraine. Oleksi Biloshytsky, the head of police in Popasna, around 100 kilometres west of Luhansk city, said that the Russian forces had used the chemical weapon in his area. "It's what Nazis called a 'flaming onion' and that's what Russcists (amalgamation of 'Russians' and 'fascists') are dropping," Biloshytsky added.

396.title: Last reserves of food and water are running out: Ukraine's Mariupol
396.article_body: The City Council of Ukraine's Mariupol on Sunday said that the last reserves of food and water are running out amid a Russian blockade. "There is no electricity, water or heating in the city. There is almost no mobile communication," it claimed. The council also said that Russian forces blockading the city continued to shell non-military targets.

397.title: I don't think about being best tennis player: Nadal on his 16-0 in 2022
397.article_body: Asked if he considers himself the "best tennis player" at present since he defeated world number one Daniil Medvedev twice recently, Rafael Nadal said he doesn't think about that and doesn't care much. "I don't put myself in that- 'I want to be...best,'" he added. The 21-time Grand Slam champion is 16-0 this season, having won three titles so far.

398.title: AirSerbia to reduce flights to Moscow post criticism from EU, Ukraine
398.article_body: Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic on Saturday said country's airline, AirSerbia will return to operating one flight a day to Moscow after "the witch hunt" against his country. This comes after EU, Ukraine criticised the Balkan nation and said that AirSerbia is profiting from the Russia-Ukraine war. Since Russia invaded Ukraine, AirSerbia had doubled the number of flights to Moscow.

399.title: His determination is an example for WI: Kraigg on Bonner's 9-hour 123 vs Eng
399.article_body: Following the drawn first West Indies-England Test, West Indies skipper Kraigg Brathwaite praised teammate Nkrumah Bonner, saying his determination is an example for the team. "He's special...has a special mindset," he added. Notably, Bonner's first innings score of 123 runs from 355 balls spanned more than nine hours, which helped his side lead England by 64 runs after first innings.

400.title: Sonia Gandhi to continue as Congress chief, CWC decides after 4.5-hr meeting
400.article_body: Days after its poll debacle in five states, Congress Working Committee on Sunday decided that Sonia Gandhi will continue as the party president. The meeting, which lasted for four-and-half-hours, was attended by Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra,  Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Mallikarjun Kharge and P Chidambaram, among others. "We all have faith in her leadership," said Kharge.
